title: 【BBC六分钟英语】泰国50年老汤真的能吃吗？
content: 【英文脚本】PhilHello. This is 6 Minute English from BBC Learning English. I’m Phil. BethAnd I’m Beth. PhilMost people have eaten some unusual food at least once in their life. What’s the most unusual thing you’ve ever eaten, Beth? BethOh, I ate camel in Australia, and I really didn’t like it, to be honest. What about you? PhilI ate caiman in Northern Argentina, and it was delicious! BethOh, OK. Good! PhilWell, in this programme we’ll be discussing some very unusual food known as ‘forever food’ – dishes, like stews and soups, which can be kept going day after day, year after year. We’ll also be learning some useful new vocabulary, all of which you can download, along with a worksheet for this programme, at our website, bbclearningenglish.com. BethBut let’s get back to forever food, and a Bangkok restaurant called, Wattana Panich, that’s famous for a soup which has been cooking for over 50 years! Here’s radio listener, David Shirley, who called BBC World Service programme, The Food Chain, after tasting the soup himself: David ShirleyI had never heard of a perpetual stew before, but the first time I’d ever heard about it was when I was in Bangkok. I found a stew that had been simmering for fifty years. PhilDavid tasted perpetual stew, a pot into which ingredients are placed and cooked continuously. The pot is never completely emptied. Instead, new ingredients and water are added when necessary and left simmering – cooking at a temperature just below boiling so that the food bubbles gently. BethA 50-year-old soup might not be to everyone’s taste, but forever foods are surprisingly common. And, Phil, I have a question for you about Wattana Panich’s 50-year-old soup. What do you think is the main ingredient? Is it: a) beef? b) chicken? or, c) vegetables? PhilOh, I think vegetables. I think that’s probably safer. BethOK. Well, we’ll find out the correct answer later in the programme. It’s not just Bangkok where people cook forever foods. Fuchsia Dunlop is a writer and cook specialising in Chinese food. Here, she tells BBC World Service programme, ‘The Food Chain’, about a Chinese stew that is rumoured to be 100 years old: Fuchsia DunlopIn China they sometimes, you know, professionals talk about having a bǎinián laolu which means, like, a 100-year-old-broth. So, I don’t know if this is strictly true, but theoretically as long as you have a good practice of hygiene - which is to say that you always skim it, and boil it every day, and also replenish it as needed with more water, more salt, more spices, and you know, you keep tasting - then it just gets richer and richer. PhilCooks need to replenish a forever stew, to fill it up again with fresh ingredients before it’s completely eaten. By being regularly replenished, some dishes are rumoured to last 100 years. BethWow, that is a long time! Fuchsia doesn’t know if it’s strictly true, or completely true, that the same stew has really lasted 100 years, but she thinks it’s possible in theory, as long as it’s kept safe and hygienic through boiling. PhilProfessor Martha Carlin is a historian with a special interest in medieval cookery. Here, she explains to BBC World Service programme, ‘The Food Chain’, why long- lasting foods could have been familiar to people in the Middle Ages: Prof Martha CarlinIn theory, it would make sense to think that people who didn’t have matches or fire starters, for whom starting a fire from scratch was quite a cumbersome process, would naturally want to keep a stew pot bubbling if they had the means to do that, and to avoid the labour of constantly restarting the fire, and also to make sure that they had a hot meal waiting at any time. BethHaving hot food bubbling away on the fire means there is always something ready to eat, and avoids having to start a fire from scratch. When you do something, like cook food or make a fire, from scratch, you do it from the beginning, without the help of anything that has already been made. PhilStarting a fire is also cumbersome, an adjective meaning difficult to do, taking time and effort. But Professor Carlin says only rich families were able to afford enough wood to keep a fire going all day. Anyway, all this talk of food has made me hungry, Beth, so what was the answer to your question? BethAh, I asked you what the main ingredient is in the Bangkok stew, and you said vegetables. And I’m afraid that’s wrong. It was, in fact, beef. OK, let’s recap the vocabulary we’ve learned in this programme about forever foods such as perpetual stew, a pot of stew into which new ingredients are regularly added, allowing the dish to be eaten over a long time. PhilWhen food is simmering, it’s cooking at a temperature slightly below boiling so that it bubbles gently. BethThe verb replenish means to fill something up again. PhilIf something is not strictly true, it’s not completely or entirely true. BethWhen you do an activity such as cooking, from scratch, you do it from the beginning, without using anything that has already been made. PhilAnd finally, if an activity is cumbersome, it’s difficult to do and takes a lot of time and effort. Once again, our six minutes are up. Remember to visit our website, bbclearningenglish.com, where you’ll find a worksheet and a quiz related to this programme, and we’ll see you again soon for more trending topics and useful vocabulary, here at 6 Minute English. Goodbye for now! BethBye! 【中英文双语脚本】Phil(菲尔)I’m Phil.你好。这是来自 BBC Learning English 的六分钟英语。我是 Phil。 Beth(贝丝)And I’m Beth.我是 Beth。 Phil(菲尔)Most people have eaten some unusual food at least once in their life. What’s the most unusual thing you’ve ever eaten, Beth?大多数人一生中至少吃过一次不寻常的食物。贝丝，你吃过的最不寻常的东西是什么？ Beth(贝丝)Oh, I ate camel in Australia, and I really didn’t like it, to be honest. What about you?哦，我在澳大利亚吃过骆驼，说实话，我真的不喜欢它。你呢？ Phil(菲尔)I ate caiman in Northern Argentina, and it was delicious!我在阿根廷北部吃了凯门鳄，很好吃！ Beth(贝丝)Oh, OK. Good!哦，好的，很好！ Phil(菲尔)Well, in this programme we’ll be discussing some very unusual food known as ‘forever food’ – dishes, like stews and soups, which can be kept going day after day, year after year. We’ll also be learning some useful new vocabulary, all of which you can download, along with a worksheet for this programme, at our website, bbclearningenglish.com.好吧，在这个节目中，我们将讨论一些非常不寻常的食物，被称为 “永恒的食物”–像炖菜和汤一样的菜肴，可以日复一日，年复一年地保持下去。我们还将学习一些有用的新词汇，所有这些词汇都可以在我们的网站上下载，以及该节目的工作表，bbclearningenglish.com。 Beth(贝丝)But let’s get back to forever food, and a Bangkok restaurant called, Wattana Panich, that’s famous for a soup which has been cooking for over 50 years! Here’s radio listener, David Shirley, who called BBC World Service programme, The Food Chain, after tasting the soup himself:但是让我们回到永恒的食物，一家名为 Wattana Panich 的曼谷餐厅，它以已经烹饪了 50 多年的汤而闻名！这是电台听众大卫·雪莉 在亲自品尝了汤后致电 BBC 世界服务节目 The Food Chain： David Shirley(大卫·雪莉)I had never heard of a perpetual stew before, but the first time I’d ever heard about it was when I was in Bangkok. I found a stew that had been simmering for fifty years.我以前从未听说过永久炖菜，但我第一次听说它是在曼谷的时候。我找到了一个炖了五十年的炖菜。 Phil(菲尔)David tasted perpetual stew, a pot into which ingredients are placed and cooked continuously. The pot is never completely emptied. Instead, new ingredients and water are added when necessary and left simmering – cooking at a temperature just below boiling so that the food bubbles gently.大卫尝到了永久炖菜的味道，这是一个将食材放入其中并不断烹饪的锅。这个罐子永远不会完全清空。相反，必要时加入新的成分和水并炖着 —— 在略低于沸腾的温度下烹饪，使食物轻轻冒泡。 Beth(贝丝)A 50-year-old soup might not be to everyone’s taste, but forever foods are surprisingly common. And, Phil, I have a question for you about Wattana Panich’s 50-year-old soup. What do you think is the main ingredient? Is it: a) beef? b) chicken? or, c) vegetables?50 年的汤可能并不符合每个人的口味，但永恒的食物却出奇地普遍。菲尔，我有一个关于 Wattana Panich 的 50 年老汤的问题要问你。您认为主要成分是什么？是：a） 牛肉？b） 鸡肉？或者，c） 蔬菜？ Phil(菲尔)Oh, I think vegetables. I think that’s probably safer.哦，我想是蔬菜。我认为这可能更安全。 Beth(贝丝)OK. Well, we’ll find out the correct answer later in the programme. It’s not just Bangkok where people cook forever foods. Fuchsia Dunlop is a writer and cook specialising in Chinese food. Here, she tells BBC World Service programme, ‘The Food Chain’, about a Chinese stew that is rumoured to be 100 years old:还行。好吧，我们将在节目的后面找到正确答案。不仅仅是曼谷，人们永远烹饪食物。Fuchsia Dunlop 是一位作家和厨师，专门研究中餐。在这里，她告诉 BBC 世界服务节目“食物链”，关于一种据传已有 100 年历史的中国炖菜： Fuchsia Dunlop(紫红色邓禄普)In China they sometimes, you know, professionals talk about having a bǎinián laolu which means, like, a 100-year-old-broth. So, I don’t know if this is strictly true, but theoretically as long as you have a good practice of hygiene - which is to say that you always skim it, and boil it every day, and also replenish it as needed with more water, more salt, more spices, and you know, you keep tasting - then it just gets richer and richer.在中国，专业人士有时会谈论 bǎinián laolu，意思是，就像 100 年的肉汤一样。所以，我不知道这是否严格来说是正确的，但从理论上讲，只要你有良好的卫生习惯 —— 也就是说，你总是撇去它，每天煮它，并根据需要补充更多的水、更多的盐、更多的香料，你知道，你不断品尝 —— 那么它就会变得越来越丰富。 Phil(菲尔)Cooks need to replenish a forever stew, to fill it up again with fresh ingredients before it’s completely eaten. By being regularly replenished, some dishes are rumoured to last 100 years.厨师需要补充永远的炖菜，在完全食用之前再次用新鲜食材填满。通过定期补充，有传言称有些菜肴可以使用 100 年。 Beth(贝丝)Wow, that is a long time! Fuchsia doesn’t know if it’s strictly true, or completely true, that the same stew has really lasted 100 years, but she thinks it’s possible in theory, as long as it’s kept safe and hygienic through boiling.哇，好好长的时间啊！Fuchsia 不知道同样的炖菜真的持续了 100 年是严格正确的还是完全正确的，但她认为理论上是可能的，只要它在煮沸时保持安全和卫生。 Phil(菲尔)Professor Martha Carlin is a historian with a special interest in medieval cookery. Here, she explains to BBC World Service programme, ‘The Food Chain’, why long- lasting foods could have been familiar to people in the Middle Ages:玛莎·卡林 教授是一位历史学家，对中世纪烹饪特别感兴趣。在这里，她向 BBC 世界服务节目“食物链”解释了为什么中世纪的人们会熟悉长效食物： Prof Martha Carlin(Martha Carlin 教授)In theory, it would make sense to think that people who didn’t have matches or fire starters, for whom starting a fire from scratch was quite a cumbersome process, would naturally want to keep a stew pot bubbling if they had the means to do that, and to avoid the labour of constantly restarting the fire, and also to make sure that they had a hot meal waiting at any time.从理论上讲，认为没有火柴或点火器的人是有道理的，对他们来说从头开始生火是一个相当繁琐的过程，如果他们有办法的话，自然会希望让炖锅冒泡，并避免不断点火的劳动。 还要确保他们随时都有热饭等着他们。 Beth(贝丝)Having hot food bubbling away on the fire means there is always something ready to eat, and avoids having to start a fire from scratch. When you do something, like cook food or make a fire, from scratch, you do it from the beginning, without the help of anything that has already been made.让热食在火上冒泡意味着总有现成的东西可以吃，并且不必从头开始生火。当你从头开始做某事时，比如做饭或生火，你从头开始做，不需要任何已经完成的帮助。 Phil(菲尔)Starting a fire is also cumbersome, an adjective meaning difficult to do, taking time and effort. But Professor Carlin says only rich families were able to afford enough wood to keep a fire going all day. Anyway, all this talk of food has made me hungry, Beth, so what was the answer to your question?生火也很麻烦，这个形容词的意思是很难做到，需要时间和精力。但卡林教授说，只有富裕家庭才能买得起足够的木材来维持一整天的火势。不管怎样，所有这些关于食物的讨论都让我饿了，贝丝，那么你的问题的答案是什么？ Beth(贝丝)Ah, I asked you what the main ingredient is in the Bangkok stew, and you said vegetables. And I’m afraid that’s wrong. It was, in fact, beef. OK, let’s recap the vocabulary we’ve learned in this programme about forever foods such as perpetual stew, a pot of stew into which new ingredients are regularly added, allowing the dish to be eaten over a long time.啊，我问你曼谷炖菜的主要成分是什么，你说蔬菜。恐怕这是错误的。事实上，它是牛肉。好，让我们回顾一下我们在这个节目中学到的关于永恒食物的词汇，比如永久炖菜，一锅炖菜，定期添加新成分，让这道菜可以长时间食用。 Phil(菲尔)When food is simmering, it’s cooking at a temperature slightly below boiling so that it bubbles gently.当食物炖煮时，它会在略低于沸腾的温度下烹饪，以便轻轻冒泡。 Beth(贝丝)The verb replenish means to fill something up again.动词 replenish 的意思是再次填充某物。 Phil(菲尔)If something is not strictly true, it’s not completely or entirely true.如果某件事不是严格正确的，那么它就不完全或完全正确。 Beth(贝丝)When you do an activity such as cooking, from scratch, you do it from the beginning, without using anything that has already been made.当您从头开始进行烹饪等活动时，您可以从头开始进行，而无需使用已经制作的任何产品。 Phil(菲尔)And finally, if an activity is cumbersome, it’s difficult to do and takes a lot of time and effort. Once again, our six minutes are up. Remember to visit our website, bbclearningenglish.com, where you’ll find a worksheet and a quiz related to this programme, and we’ll see you again soon for more trending topics and useful vocabulary, here at 6 Minute English. Goodbye for now!最后，如果一项活动很麻烦，那就很难做，并且需要大量的时间和精力。我们的六分钟又结束了。记得访问我们的网站 bbclearningenglish.com，在那里您可以找到与此计划相关的工作表和测验，我们很快就会再次见到您，了解更多热门话题和有用的词汇，请访问 6 Minute English。再见！ Beth(贝丝)Bye!再见！ 【核心词汇】perpetual stewpot of stew into which new ingredients are regularly added so that the food is kept going and can be eaten over a long time永续炖菜长期熬制的炖菜，不断添加新的食材以保持其持续供应并可长期食用。The perpetual stew simmered gently on the back burner, a constant source of comfort in the chilly kitchen.寒冷的厨房里，后炉子上慢炖着永续炖菜，它持续地带来慰藉。 simmeringcooking at a temperature slightly below boiling so that the food bubbles gently慢炖以低于沸点的温度烹调，使食物轻轻冒泡。The sauce was simmering gently, its aroma filling the kitchen.酱汁在轻轻地炖着，香味弥漫着整个厨房。 replenishfill up again补充再次装满；补充。We need to replenish our supplies of food and water before the long journey.在长途跋涉之前，我们需要补充食物和水。 not strictly truenot completely or entirely true并非完全属实并非完全或全部属实。His account of the events was not strictly true, omitting several key details.他对事件的描述并非完全属实，省略了一些关键细节。 from scratchfrom the beginning, without the help of anything that has already been made从零开始从头开始，没有任何现成的东西的帮助。She baked the cake entirely from scratch, using only fresh ingredients.她完全从零开始烘焙蛋糕，只使用新鲜的食材。 cumbersomedifficult to do; taking a lot of time and effort繁琐的难以做到；费时费力。The process was cumbersome and inefficient, requiring numerous steps and approvals.这个过程繁琐且低效，需要许多步骤和批准。 在公众号里输入6位数字，获取【对话音频、英文文本、中文翻译、核心词汇和高级词汇表】电子档，6位数字【暗号】在文章的最后一张图片，如【220728】，表示22年7月28日这一期。公众号没有的文章说明还没有制作相关资料。年度合集在B站【六分钟英语】工房获取，每年共计300+文档，感谢支持！
tags: 六分钟英语

title: 【BBC六分钟英语】你喝了足够的水吗？
content: 【英文脚本】PhilHello. This is 6 Minute English from BBC Learning English. I’m Phil. BethAnd I’m Beth. Nowadays, I often see people carrying water bottles with them to make sure they drink enough. How much water do you drink a day, Phil? PhilOh, I don’t know. Maybe about a litre? BethOK. And do you know how much water you should drink a day? PhilI think it’s probably about two litres. BethAh, well, the number many people have heard is two litres a day. Of course, everyone needs to drink some water - over half the human body is made up of it. But exactly how much water do we need to stay healthy? That’s what we’ll be discussing in this programme, along with some useful new vocabulary as well. PhilAnd speaking of vocabulary, remember you can download all the new words and phrases from this programme, plus worksheet exercises to help you learn them, on our website, bbclearningenglish.com. BethGreat! But first I have a question for you, Phil. I mentioned that over half the human body consists of water, but there’s an even higher percentage of water in our blood. But how much? Is our blood: a) around 80% water? b) around 90% water? or, c) 100% water? PhilI think it’s around 80% water. BethOK, I will reveal the correct answer later in the programme. Our blood needs water so it can carry nutrients to the body’s cells and organs. The amount recommended is often given as two litres a day. But why? Here to discuss this with BBC World Service programme, The Food Chain, is biologist, Professor John Speakman: Professor John SpeakmanSo, I’m not sure how it was arrived at but it seems to be a number that has taken grip on a very large number of countries. So, if you look at government recommendations around the world, they’re pretty much all the same. They pretty much all say everybody’s got to be drinking two litres of water. PhilProfessor Speakman doesn’t know how the number of two litres a day was arrived at – how it was decided or calculated. Nevertheless, the idea of drinking two litres a day has taken grip on many governments around the world. When you say an idea has taken grip on something, you mean it’s taken control of it. BethYes, Professor Speakman says that pretty much all governments are giving pretty much the same recommendation. He uses the phrase, pretty much, to mean almost. For example, ‘pretty much all governments advise drinking two litres a day’ means ‘almost all governments advise it’. PhilWhat Professor Speakman doesn’t have, however, is any scientific evidence for this advice. The number of exactly two litres isn’t based on scientific fact, it’s more of a ballpark figure – a number which is a guess, but which you still believe is approximately correct. BethActually, the amount of water in our bodies is changing all the time. Like your bank balance, which goes down when you spend money, your body loses water all the time, when you breathe, sweat, or go to the toilet. Exactly how much you need to drink depends on how much water your body needs to replace, and that mainly depends on your size. PhilBut what happens when we drink less than we should? Here’s hydration expert, Dr Nidia Rodriguez-Sanchez, describing the effects of dehydration to BBC World Service’s, The Food Chain. Dr Nidia Rodriguez-SanchezAnd also, many times we start getting dehydrated and we don’t realise we are dehydrated. So it’s very common that we feel tired, or we feel, like, with a bit of a headache, or even we think we’re hungry, and we go and get some food. And actually what is happening is that we are thirsty, that we are dehydrated, we are starting to show some signs or some symptoms of dehydration. PhilDr Sanchez describes the effects of dehydration, the condition of not having enough water in your body so that you feel ill or weak. She mentions feeling tired, having a headache or a dry mouth as symptoms of dehydration. Symptoms are signs or feelings in the body showing the presence of some illness or condition. BethSo, whether you drink a little more, or a little less, it seems that around two litres of water a day is a good way to keep your blood and body healthy. Speaking of which, Phil, it’s time to reveal the answer to my question, what percentage of our blood is water? You said 80%, and the answer is 90%. Our blood consists of around 90% water. OK, let’s recap the vocabulary we’ve used, starting with the phrase to arrive at a number, meaning to decide it by doing calculations. PhilIf an idea takes grip on something, it takes control of it. BethThe phrase pretty much means almost; for example, pretty much everyone likes chocolate, which means almost everyone likes chocolate. PhilA ballpark figure is a phrase meaning a number which is an acceptably accurate approximation. BethDehydration is the condition of not having enough water in your body so that you feel ill or weak. PhilAnd finally, a symptom is a sign or feeling in the body showing the presence of an illness or condition. Once again, our six minutes are up. Why not join me now and head over to our website, bbclearningenglish.com, download the worksheet for this programme, and test yourself to see how much you remember? See you there soon! BethBye! 【中英文双语脚本】Phil(菲尔)I’m Phil.你好。这是来自 BBC Learning English 的六分钟英语。我是 Phil。 Beth(贝丝)And I’m Beth. Nowadays, I often see people carrying water bottles with them to make sure they drink enough. How much water do you drink a day, Phil?我是 Beth。如今，我经常看到人们随身携带水瓶以确保他们喝得足够。你每天喝多少水，Phil？ Phil(菲尔)Oh, I don’t know. Maybe about a litre?哦，我不知道。也许大约一升？ Beth(贝丝)OK. And do you know how much water you should drink a day?还行。你知道你每天应该喝多少水吗？ Phil(菲尔)I think it’s probably about two litres.我想大概是两升。 Beth(贝丝)Ah, well, the number many people have heard is two litres a day. Of course, everyone needs to drink some water - over half the human body is made up of it. But exactly how much water do we need to stay healthy? That’s what we’ll be discussing in this programme, along with some useful new vocabulary as well.啊，嗯，很多人听说的数字是每天两升。当然，每个人都需要喝一些水 —— 人体的一半以上是由水组成的。但是，我们究竟需要多少水才能保持健康呢？这就是我们将在本节目中讨论的内容，以及一些有用的新词汇。 Phil(菲尔)And speaking of vocabulary, remember you can download all the new words and phrases from this programme, plus worksheet exercises to help you learn them, on our website, bbclearningenglish.com.说到词汇，请记住，您可以在我们的网站上下载该节目中的所有新单词和短语，以及帮助您学习它们的工作表练习，bbclearningenglish.com。 Beth(贝丝)Great! But first I have a question for you, Phil. I mentioned that over half the human body consists of water, but there’s an even higher percentage of water in our blood. But how much? Is our blood: a) around 80% water? b) around 90% water? or, c) 100% water?太好了！但首先我有一个问题要问你，Phil。我提到过，人体的一半以上由水组成，但我们血液中的水比例甚至更高。但多少呢？我们的血液是否：a） 大约 80% 是水？b） 大约 90% 的水？或者，c） 100% 水？ Phil(菲尔)I think it’s around 80% water.我认为大约 80% 是水。 Beth(贝丝)OK, I will reveal the correct answer later in the programme. Our blood needs water so it can carry nutrients to the body’s cells and organs. The amount recommended is often given as two litres a day. But why? Here to discuss this with BBC World Service programme, The Food Chain, is biologist, Professor John Speakman:好的，我将在稍后的节目中透露正确答案。我们的血液需要水，这样才能将营养物质输送到身体的细胞和器官。建议的量通常为每天 2 升。但是为什么？在这里与 BBC 世界服务节目《食物链》讨论这个问题的是生物学家约翰·斯皮克曼教授： Professor John Speakman(John Speakman 教授)So, I’m not sure how it was arrived at but it seems to be a number that has taken grip on a very large number of countries. So, if you look at government recommendations around the world, they’re pretty much all the same. They pretty much all say everybody’s got to be drinking two litres of water.所以，我不确定它是如何得出的，但这个数字似乎已经控制了非常多的国家。所以，如果你看一下世界各地的政府建议，它们几乎都是一样的。他们几乎都说每个人都必须喝两升水。 Phil(菲尔)Professor Speakman doesn’t know how the number of two litres a day was arrived at – how it was decided or calculated. Nevertheless, the idea of drinking two litres a day has taken grip on many governments around the world. When you say an idea has taken grip on something, you mean it’s taken control of it.Speakman 教授不知道每天 2 升的水数是如何得出的 —— 它是如何决定或计算的。尽管如此，每天喝两升的想法已经影响了世界各地的许多政府。当你说一个想法已经抓住了某件事时，你的意思是它已经控制了它。 Beth(贝丝)Yes, Professor Speakman says that pretty much all governments are giving pretty much the same recommendation. He uses the phrase, pretty much, to mean almost. For example, ‘pretty much all governments advise drinking two litres a day’ means ‘almost all governments advise it’.是的，斯皮克曼教授说，几乎所有政府都给出了几乎相同的建议。他用这个词，几乎是，意思几乎。例如，“几乎所有政府都建议每天喝两升”的意思是“几乎所有政府都建议这样做”。 Phil(菲尔)What Professor Speakman doesn’t have, however, is any scientific evidence for this advice. The number of exactly two litres isn’t based on scientific fact, it’s more of a ballpark figure – a number which is a guess, but which you still believe is approximately correct.然而，斯皮克曼教授没有为这个建议提供任何科学证据。正好 2 升的数字不是基于科学事实，它更像是一个大概的数字 —— 一个猜测的数字，但你仍然相信它大致正确。 Beth(贝丝)Actually, the amount of water in our bodies is changing all the time. Like your bank balance, which goes down when you spend money, your body loses water all the time, when you breathe, sweat, or go to the toilet. Exactly how much you need to drink depends on how much water your body needs to replace, and that mainly depends on your size.实际上，我们体内的水量一直在变化。就像你花钱时银行余额会下降一样，当你呼吸、出汗或上厕所时，你的身体会一直流失水分。你到底需要喝多少水取决于你的身体需要补充多少水，而这主要取决于你的体型。 Phil(菲尔)But what happens when we drink less than we should? Here’s hydration expert, Dr Nidia Rodriguez-Sanchez, describing the effects of dehydration to BBC World Service’s, The Food Chain.但是，当我们喝得少于我们应该喝的少时会发生什么呢？这是补水专家 Nidia Rodriguez-Sanchez 博士向 BBC 国际频道的 The Food Chain 描述脱水的影响。 Dr Nidia Rodriguez-Sanchez(Nidia Rodriguez-Sanchez 医师)And also, many times we start getting dehydrated and we don’t realise we are dehydrated. So it’s very common that we feel tired, or we feel, like, with a bit of a headache, or even we think we’re hungry, and we go and get some food. And actually what is happening is that we are thirsty, that we are dehydrated, we are starting to show some signs or some symptoms of dehydration.而且，很多时候我们开始脱水，但我们没有意识到我们脱水了。因此，我们感到疲倦，或者我们感到有点头痛，甚至我们认为我们饿了，然后我们去吃点东西，这是很常见的。实际上，我们正在发生的事情是我们口渴，我们脱水，我们开始出现一些脱水的迹象或症状。 Phil(菲尔)Dr Sanchez describes the effects of dehydration, the condition of not having enough water in your body so that you feel ill or weak. She mentions feeling tired, having a headache or a dry mouth as symptoms of dehydration. Symptoms are signs or feelings in the body showing the presence of some illness or condition.Sanchez 博士描述了脱水的影响，脱水是指体内水分不足，以至于您感到不适或虚弱的情况。她提到感到疲倦、头痛或口干是脱水的症状。症状是体内显示存在某种疾病或病症的迹象或感觉。 Beth(贝丝)So, whether you drink a little more, or a little less, it seems that around two litres of water a day is a good way to keep your blood and body healthy. Speaking of which, Phil, it’s time to reveal the answer to my question, what percentage of our blood is water? You said 80%, and the answer is 90%. Our blood consists of around 90% water. OK, let’s recap the vocabulary we’ve used, starting with the phrase to arrive at a number, meaning to decide it by doing calculations.因此，无论您多喝一点还是少喝一点，每天喝两升左右的水似乎都是保持血液和身体健康的好方法。说到这里，Phil，是时候揭示我问题的答案了，我们血液中有多少百分比是水？你说 80%，答案是 90%。我们的血液由大约 90% 的水组成。好，让我们回顾一下我们使用的词汇，从短语开始得出一个数字，意思是通过计算来决定它。 Phil(菲尔)If an idea takes grip on something, it takes control of it.如果一个想法抓住了某件事，它就会控制它。 Beth(贝丝)The phrase pretty much means almost; for example, pretty much everyone likes chocolate, which means almost everyone likes chocolate.这个短语的意思是几乎；例如，几乎每个人都喜欢巧克力，这意味着几乎每个人都喜欢巧克力。 Phil(菲尔)A ballpark figure is a phrase meaning a number which is an acceptably accurate approximation.一个大概的数字是一个短语，意思是一个数字，这是一个可以接受的准确近似值。 Beth(贝丝)Dehydration is the condition of not having enough water in your body so that you feel ill or weak.脱水是指体内没有足够的水分，以至于您感到不适或虚弱的情况。 Phil(菲尔)And finally, a symptom is a sign or feeling in the body showing the presence of an illness or condition. Once again, our six minutes are up. Why not join me now and head over to our website, bbclearningenglish.com, download the worksheet for this programme, and test yourself to see how much you remember? See you there soon!最后，症状是体内表明存在疾病或病症的迹象或感觉。我们的六分钟又结束了。为什么不现在就加入我，前往我们的网站，bbclearningenglish.com，下载此计划的工作表，并测试自己，看看您记得多少呢？期待很快与您相见！ Beth(贝丝)Bye!再见！ 【核心词汇】arrive atcalculate; decide on it after doing calculations到达计算；经过计算后决定The delegates arrived at a compromise after hours of negotiation.经过数小时的谈判，代表们达成了一项妥协。 take grip ontake control of掌控控制She took a firm grip on the situation and resolved the crisis efficiently.她牢牢掌控局面，高效地解决了危机。 pretty muchalmost; almost completely几乎；差不多几乎；几乎完全The project is pretty much finished; we just need to finalize a few details.项目几乎完成了；我们只需要完成一些细节。 ballpark figurea number which is a guess but an acceptably accurate approximation大概数字一个数字，它是猜测的，但却是可以接受的准确近似值They gave me a ballpark figure for the cost of the renovation.他们给了我装修费用的一个大概数字。 dehydrationcondition of not having enough water in your body so that you feel ill or weak脱水身体缺水以致感到不适或虚弱的状况Prolonged exposure to the sun can lead to severe dehydration.长时间暴露在阳光下会导致严重脱水。 symptomsign or feeling in the body showing the presence of illness or a condition症状身体上显示疾病或状况存在的征兆或感觉A high fever is a common symptom of influenza.高烧是流感的常见症状。 在公众号里输入6位数字，获取【对话音频、英文文本、中文翻译、核心词汇和高级词汇表】电子档，6位数字【暗号】在文章的最后一张图片，如【220728】，表示22年7月28日这一期。公众号没有的文章说明还没有制作相关资料。年度合集在B站【六分钟英语】工房获取，每年共计300+文档，感谢支持！

title: 考研词汇精选-109
content: 01 delinquency [dɪˈlɪŋ.kwənt.si] n.【法律】少年犯罪，不法行为（青少年），行为不当；失职，玩忽职守，拖欠债务，缺点，过错 词根助记de一再+ linqu离开+ ency,表名词→不走 (离开)正道→（常指青少年的）违法。 n.【法律】少年犯罪，不法行为（青少年），行为不当School bullying is a kind of delinquency which will not be tolerated.校园霸凌是少年犯罪的一种，对此不应有丝毫容忍。 02 autonomy [ɔːˈtɒn.ə.mi $ ɑːˈtɑː.nə-] n. 自主权；自治；自治权；人身自由；【财】自主权，自治权 词根助记auto自己+ nomy系统，统治→自己统治→autonomy自主权 n. 自主权Parents give the child autonomy to make her favorite juice.父母给了这个孩子自主权去做她喜欢的果汁。 Too much dependence on the teacher risks loss of autonomy and motivation to discover.过度依赖老师可能会失去自主权和发现的动力。来源：剑10 Test2 阅读 03 jaw [dʒɔː] n. 口部；颌，颚，下巴；口部，嘴；v.崂叨叨，噗不休 谐音助记jaw谐音：嚼－一嚼东西时，“下巴”要发力 n. 口部The doctor is putting a mouth guard in my jaw.医生正在把牙套放在我的口中。 … will not die of drought, of starvation or in the jaws of a predator..不会死于干旱，饥饿，也不会死于掠食者的口中。来源：剑14 Test4 阅读 04 shrub [ˌsaɪ.ə.miːzˈtwɪnz] n. 灌木;【生】灌木 联想助记他在”灌木”丛（shrub）里向我耸肩（shrug） n. 灌木The shrubs in the park had been pruned into the shape of balls.公园里的灌木被修剪成了球形。 These baits can be placed either on the ground or on the trunks of trees or large shrubs.这些诱饵可以放在地面上，也可以放在树干或大灌木上。来源：剑8 Test4 阅读 05 infringement [/ɪnˈfrɪndʒmənt/] n. 违反；驳斥；侵犯 词根助记infringe侵犯，违反+ment名词后缀→infringement驳斥；违反 n. 违反Driving while tired is an infringement of the law and is punishable by fine.疲劳驾驶违反了法律，需处以罚款。 06 abridge [əˈbrɪdʒ] v. 删节；削减 词根助记助记：a去掉+ bridg缩短+e→缩短。 v. 删节He has been asked to abridge his novel by removing an entire page.他被要求通过删除整页内容来缩短他的小说。 07 insofar [ˌɪnsəˈbraɪəti] adv. 在范围内；到这种程度；在这个范围内 adv. 在范围内The boy tried to pull himself up insofar as he can.男孩正尽他可能地做引体向上。 08 lad [læd] n. 小伙子 联想助记“小伙子”（lad）领导（lead）团队。 n. 小伙子This group of lads all have a different style.这群小伙子风格各异。 09 scrutiny [ˌsaɪ.ə.miːzˈtwɪnz] n.监视，细看，详细检查，仔细观察；【财】审查 词根助记scrut搜查，调查+iny表名词→ scrutiny详细检查，仔细观察 n. 监视，细看，详细检查，仔细观察The exam was going on under the scrutiny of the teacher.考试在老师的严格监视下进行。 A field of knowledge or a professional endeavor is defined by both the means and the end; hence both deserve scrutiny.一个知识领域或一项专业努力是由手段和目的来定义的;因此，两者都值得审视。来源：剑12 Test5 阅读 10 bonded [ˈbɒn.dɪdʒ $ ˈbɑːn-] adj. 保税的；以债券作保证的；有担保的；存入保税仓库的 词根助记bond债券+ ed adj. 保税的Exporters who put goods in the bonded area will not be taxed just now.将货物放入保税区的出口商暂时不会被征税。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-108
content: 01 bacterium [bækˈtɪə.ri.əm $ -ˈtɪr.i-] n. 细菌 词根助记bacter细菌+ium表名词→bacterium细菌 n. 细菌This kind of bacterium can cause a very dangerous disease.这种细菌能引发非常危险的疾病。 … that can be halted by a rare microbial bacterium.·……可以被一种罕见的微生物细菌阻止。来源：剑16 Test2 阅读 02 fir [ˈfɜːr $ ˈfɝːr] n.杉木 象形助记 n. 杉木Fir trees are normally found in hilly areas.冷杉常常出现在山峦起伏的地区。 03 quiver [ˈkwɪv.ər $ -ɚ] vi.颤抖；n.颤抖；箭袋 象形助记 vi. 颤抖This boy was quivering as he walked down the street on a cold day.这个男孩走在街上瑟瑟发抖，因为天气太冷了。 04 envision [ɪnˈvɪʒn] vt.预测，想象，展望 词根助记en进入+vision景象→进入一种景象→envision预测，想象，展望。 vt. 预测，想象，展望The man envisions his future family, house, car and degree.这个男人在想象他未来的家庭、房子、汽车和学位。 We are aware that the product we have envisioned is mainly finding application in the developing world and humanitarian sector ..我们意识到，我们设想的产品主要在发展中国家和人道主义部门得到应用…来源：剑15 Test3 阅读 05 tan [tæn] n. 晒成棕褐色或晒黑的皮肤；棕褐色，棕黄色；v. 使晒成棕褐色；硝制 (皮革)；adj.棕黄色的，棕褐色的 谐音助记tan谐音：碳n晒成像碳一样的”棕褐色”皮肤。 n. 晒成棕褐色或晒黑的皮肤I can get a tan while lying in the sun.躺在阳光下，我就会晒黑。 06 irritate [ˈɪrɪteɪt] v. 使恼怒，使烦躁；刺激 词根助记ir使+rit摩擦+ ate表动词→一直在摩擦→irritate使烦躁 v. 使恼怒，使烦躁Irritated by defeat, the boy stamped his feet in anger.比赛失利令男孩恼怒，气得直脚。 07 outcast [ˈaʊt.treɪ] n. 被逐出者；流浪者；adj. 被抛弃的，被逐出的 词根助记out超过，出去+cast扔→扔出去→outcast被逐出者 n. 被逐出者The red man is an outcast; nobody wants to talk to him.那个红色的人被排斥了，没有人想要和他说话。 08 peruse [pəˈruːz] v. 精读；详细考察 词根助记per完全的+use使用→完全使用一本书→peruse精读 v. 精读You should peruse the terms and conditions carefully before signing a contract.签署合同前务必仔细阅读使用条款及细则。 While perusing a book on the monuments of Egypt, she noticed a hieroglyph that …在仔细阅读一本关于埃及古迹的书时，她注意到一个象形文字.来源：剑7 Test4 阅读 09 clause [klɔːz] n. 条款；从句 象形助记 n. 条款The tenant will sign the tenancy agreement after checking every clause.房客核对完每条条款后才会签署租房合同。 10 gravel [ˈɡræv.əl] n. 沙砾，小石，砾石；adj. 粗重而沙哑的，刺耳的；vt.用砾石铺；使困惑 联想助记“”坟墓”（grave）是由”沙砾”（gravel）堆积成的。 n. 沙砾，小石，砾石There is lots of gravel along the road.路上有许多碎石。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-107
content: 01 fumble [ˈfʌm.bl̩] v. 摸索，笨拙地做，漏球；接球失误（又作mishandle)；n.摸索，笨拙的处理，漏球；adj.笨拙的；迟疑的 联想助记他”笨拙地做事”（fumble）结果绊倒了(stumble)。 v. 摸索，笨拙地做，漏球The girl fumbled in her bag for some small change.那个女孩在翻包找零钱。 02 pervert [pəˈvɜːt $ pɚˈvɝːt] v. 使堕落，误导，曲解；n. 变态，色狼 词根助记per坏+vert转→转向坏→pervert使堕落，误导，曲解 v. 使堕落，误导，曲解TV violence perverts the minds of young children.电视暴力腐蚀了孩子们的心灵。 03 mimic [ˈmɪm.ɪk] v.模仿，戏弄；模仿；n.模仿者；adj.模拟的；假的，伪装的 词根助记mim=希腊语mimos模仿者+ic形容词后缀→mimic模仿，戏弄 v. 模仿，戏弄The panda can perfectly mimic Jin’s expression.这只熊猫完美的模仿了金馆长的表情。 … the effects they can have on the world around them is provided when others mimic them.当其他人模仿婴儿时，可以为婴儿提供有关其对周围世界的影响…来源：剑9 Test4 阅读 04 allude [əˈluːd] v. 间接提到，暗指，暗示 词根助记al不断+lude玩，戏剧→不断演戏→不直截了当→allude间接提到 v. 间接提到，暗指，暗示She was alluding to Pinocchio when she told the man his nose was getting longer.她告诉这个男人他的鼻子在变长，其实是在暗指他是匹诺曹。 05 corrode [kəˈrəʊd $ -ˈroʊd] v. 受腐蚀；腐蚀，侵蚀 词根助记cor完全+rode啃咬→全部咬掉→corrode腐蚀，侵蚀 v. 受腐蚀The metal corroded because you left it out in the rain for too long.由于长时间淋雨，该金属被腐蚀了。 06 toddle [ˈtɒdl] v. （如小孩）購珊学步；n.刚学走步的小孩；东倒西歪的走路 联想助记一个步履螨珊（dodder）的老人牵着一个”螨珊学步”（toddle）的小孩。 v.（如小孩）蹒跚学步The baby has just learnt to toddle, so he walks unsteadily.孩子才刚蹒跚学步，走得还不稳。 07 exhort [ɪɡˈzɔːt] vt.敦促，劝告；vi.规劝，劝告 词根助记ex出+hort鼓励→出去鼓励别人→exhort敦促，劝告 vt. 敦促，劝告Environmentalists exhort people to reduce, reuse, and recycle.环保主义者敦促人们减少消耗、重复使用及回收资源。 08 conceptive [kənˈsep.ʃən] adj. 有感知能力的；概念的；感知的 词根助记concept 观念，想法+ive表形容词→conceptive有感知能力的 adj. 有感知能力的A baby develops his conceptive ability when he meets new things.当婴儿遇到新事物时，他的感知能力便得到发展。 09 coefficient [ˌkəʊɪˈfɪʃnt] n.【数】系数；adj 共同作用的 象形助记 n.【数】系数A coefficient is a number which is placed before another quantity and multiplies it.系数是放在另一个量前面并与之相乘的数字。 10 fluctuation [/ˌflʌktʃuˈeɪʃn/] n. 波动；起伏 词根助记fluctu波浪＋ ation表示行为、情况、状态、过程、结果→fluctuation波动，起伏 n. 波动The fluctuation in our data shows that our production is not stable enough.数据的波动说明了我们的产量还不够稳定。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-106
content: 01 wreathe [ren] v. 环绕盘旋；环绕；盘绕；作成花圈 联想助记花”环绕”（wreathe）在枝条上，形成了一个花环(wreath) v. 环绕盘旋The round table is wreathed with flowers.圆桌被花朵围绕着。 02 stride [straɪd] n. 进展，进步；大步；阔步行走的姿势；一大步；跨越；【计】步长；v. 大步走；越过；跨越；vt.大步走过；跨骑在..上 联想助记这个事情能得到”正常的进展”（stride），是因为大家努力奋斗（strive）。 n. 进展，进步She is making great strides in violin playing.她在小提琴演奏方面进步很大。 But while a few countries are making major strides in this regard, ··但是，尽管一些国家在这方面取得了重大进展，来源：剑11 Test1 阅读 03 reticent [ˈrev.ər.ənd $ -rənd $ -ɚ.ənd] adj. 含蓄的，不愿交谈的；沉默不语的；有保留的 词根助记retic安静+ent形容词后缀→reticent含蓄的；沉默不语的 adj. 含蓄的，不愿交谈的He is clearly reticent about discussing his private life.他明显不愿谈论自己的私生活。 04 consolation [ˌkɒn.səˈleɪ.ʃən $ ˌkɑːn-] n. 安慰；慰藉 词根助记con共同+ sol(e)安慰+ ation →一起安慰→consolation安慰 n. 安慰Her mother cooking her favorite meal was a nice consolation when she failed her exam.当她考试失利时，母亲做了她最爱的饭菜便是很好的安慰。 05 pierce [pɪəs $ pɪrs] v. 贯穿；穿（子L）；突破 联想助记一片一片的（piece）很容易被”贯穿”（pierce) v. 贯穿The arrow pierced through Achilles’ ankle.箭贯穿了阿喀琉斯的脚踝。 They had a bronze battering ram, which was used to pierce the timber or break the oars of enemy vessels.他们有一个青铜攻城槌，用来刺穿木材或打破敌人船只的桨。来源：剑16 Test3 阅读 06 courtesy [ˈkɜːtəsi] n. 礼貌;【财】礼貌 联想助记在法庭（court）中保持”礼貌”（courtesy） n. 礼貌He helped her out of the car out of courtesy.他出于礼貌扶她下了车。 07 fortress [ˈfɔː.trəs $ ˈfɔːr-] n. 堡垒；要塞 词根助记fort力量，坚固+ress表名词，一种状态→坚固有力量的状态→fortress堡垒 n. 堡垒Thick, high walls make a fortress hard to attack.高厚的墙壁让这座城堡难以被攻击。 Built by the Romans in 90 AD, it became a fortress with four towers after the fifth century, …它由罗马人于公元90年建造，在五世纪后成为一座有四个塔楼的堡垒,来源：剑17 Test1 阅读 n.要塞.., from military fortress to residential village,…，从军事要塞到居民村，来源：剑17 Test1 阅读 08 pathos [ˈpeɪ.θɒs $ -θɑːs] n. 悲怆，哀婉；痛苦；感染力 象形助记 n. 悲怆，哀婉Usually, some movies have pathos, which tug at people’s emotions.般来说，有些电影有令人落泪的感伤力，能够触动人们的情感。 09 pail [peɪl] n. 提桶 象形助记 n. 提桶Please pick up the pail of butter and bring it over here.请把这桶黄油提过来。 10 sensational [ˌsaɪ.ə.miːzˈtwɪnz] adj. 轰动性的；使人感动的，非常好的；引起哗然的 词根助记sensation轰动+ al形容词后缀→ sensational轰动性的 adj. 轰动性的A piece of sensational news spread over our company.一则轰动性的消息传遍了我们公司。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-105
content: 01 constantly [ˈkɒnt.stənt.li $ ˈkɑːnt-] adv. 不断地，时常地 词根助记constant不断的+ly副词后缀→constantly不断地，时常地 adv. 不断地，时常地He is constantly updating his blog.他不断地更新他的博客。 These communities are constantly changing too.这些社区也在不断变化。来源：剑16 Test2 阅读 02 reckless [ˈrek.ləs] adj.鲁莽的，不顾后果的；不顾虑的；粗心大意的 词根助记reck顾虑+less无….的→reckless鲁莽的，不顾后果的 adj. 鲁莽的，不顾后果的It is reckless for the driver to be driving while texting on the phone.驾驶员一边开车一边用手机打字的行为是很不顾后果的。 The continuous and reckless use of synthetic chemicals for the control of pests ..为了控制害虫而连续和不顾后果地使用合成化学品…来源：剑8 Test4 阅读 03 incidentally [ˌɪnsɪˈdentli] adv.顺便；偶然地，不经意地；附带，捎带 联想助记“偶然地”（incidentally）发生了几件事(incident) adv. 顺便Incidentally, I think you still owe me some money.顺便说一句，我想你还欠我一些钱。 …but there was also a larger proportion of ‘low’ attainers in England, where, incidentally, the variation in attainment scores was much greater..但在英国，“低”成就者的比例也更大，顺便说一句，那里的成就分数差异要大得多。来源：剑8 Test4 阅读 04 mariner [məˈriːnz] n. 水手；海员 词根助记marine海+er表人→海的人→mariner海员 n. 水手He is an ancient mariner.他是一个年迈的水手。 …Roman mariners estimated directions from the pole star or, with less accuracy, from the Sun at noon..罗马水手根据北极星或正午的太阳来估计方向，精确度较低。来源：剑16 Test3 阅读 05 ration [ˈræʃ.ən] n. 定量配给；v. 配给；定量供应 词根助记rat计算+ ion表名词→ration定量配给 n. 定量配给Everyone had to queue for their face mask ration.每个人都得排队领取定量配给的口罩。 06 auxiliary [ɔːɡˈzɪl.i.ər.i $ ɑːɡˈzɪl.i.er-] adj. 备用的，辅助的，协助的；附属的；【计】辅助的；n.帮助者，辅助物；助动词 词根助记auxili帮助+ ary…的→ auxiliary辅助的 adj. 备用的，辅助的，协助的We have an auxiliary generator to deal with sudden black-outs.我们有一个备用的发电机防止突然停电。 07 v. 垂直或突然地堕下，骤然下降；暴跌；n.测锤（钓丝的）坠子；线锤；铅锤线；锤规 联想助记plum（梅子）落到了（met）地面上 v. 垂直或突然地堕下，骤然下降The eagle plummets to the earth to catch the rabbit.老鹰俯冲到地面去抓兔子。 . when a major fast-food company then made the same demands after customer purchases of its hamburgers plummeted…当一家大型快餐公司在顾客汉堡购买量暴跌后提出同样的要求时.来源：剑15 Test4 阅读 08 prominence [ˈprɒm.ɪ.nənts $ ˈprɑː.mə-] n. 显著，突出；卓越；突出物 词根助记pro向前+ min伸+ ence表名词→ prominence显著,突出 n. 显著，突出Bike sharing has gained prominence in recent years.共享单车在近几年越来越流行。 09 renaissance [rɪˈneɪsns] n. 文艺复兴;新生，复兴 词根助记re重新+naiss诞生+ ance表名词，情况、性质、行为→renaissance文艺复兴 n.文艺复兴Many masterpieces were created during the Renaissance.文艺复兴时期杰作层出不穷。 10 scarce [skeəs $ skers] adj. 缺乏的，不足的；稀少的，罕见的；adv. 仅仅，几乎不 联想助记人们对物资的”缺乏”（scarce）感到恐慌（scare）。 adj. 缺乏的，不足的Oil is becoming increasingly scarce on Earth.地球上的石油已经变得越来越匮乏了。 When food is scarce, bats become a crucial source of protein for local people.当食物短缺时，蝙蝠成为当地人重要的蛋白质来源。来源：剑17 Test4 阅读
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-104
content: 01 undulate [ˈʌndjuleɪt] v. 波动，起伏；adj 波动的；波浪形的 词根助记und=拉丁语unda水波+ate动词后缀→ undulate波动，起伏 v.波动，起伏The green hills undulate, forming a beautiful landscape.翠绿山峦波浪起伏，形成一幅优美的景色。 02 fraud [frɔːd $ frɑːd] n. 欺诈，诈骗；骗子;【财】欺诈，舞弊；欺诈 谐音助记fraud谐音：富饶的富饶的地方”诈骗”多。 n.欺诈，诈骗Be careful! This is highly likely a fraud call!当心！这极有可能是个诈骗电话！ Many people have suffered from telecom fraud.许多人都遭受过电信诈骗。 We have another term for it: fraud.我们还有另一个术语：欺诈。来源：剑12 Test5 阅读 03 bunk [ˈbɜː.bər.i $ ˈbɝː.ber-] n.（火车等）床铺，铺位，卧铺；骗人的话，废话；v.睡（在床铺上），去睡 联想助记火车上的每一个和尚（monk）都有自己的”床铺”(bunk)。 n.（火车等）床铺，铺位，卧铺If you want a top bunk in the train, you’d better book one as soon as you can.如果你想要火车的上铺床位，你最好赶紧订票。 04 shun [ˌsaɪ.ə.miːzˈtwɪnz] v.（有意或习惯性地）避开，躲开 象形助记 v.（有意或习惯性地）避开，躲开I shun bad publicity as much as I can.我尽量躲开负面宣传。 While at Bell Laboratories, Shannon developed information theory, but shunned the resulting acclaim.在贝尔实验室期间，Shannon完善了信息理论，但回避了由此获得的赞誉。来源：剑9 Test3 阅读 05 constitutive [ˌkɒnstɪˈtjuːtɪv] adj. 基本的；构成的；章程的；本质的 词根助记con一起+stitut建立+ive形容后缀→一起建立雏形→constitutive基本的 adj. 基本的The constitutive elements of a good diet are vitamins and proteins.良好饮食的基本组成元素是维生素和蛋白质。 06 detergent [dɪˈtɜːdʒənt] n. 洗涤剂，清洁剂;【化】清洁剂，洗涤剂 词根助记de离开+terge擦+ent名词后缀→detergent洗涤剂，清洁剂 n. 洗涤剂，清洁剂Detergent can remove dirt from clothes and make them clean.洗涤剂可以去除衣物上的污渍，使其变干净。 There are studies indicating that the excessive use of household detergents …有研究表明，过量使用家用洗涤剂.来源：剑16 Test2 阅读 07 indent [ɪnˈdent] v.（书写）缩排，印刷；切割成锯齿状；定货；印凹痕（读作/in’dent/）；【计】缩排；n.缩进；契约；订货单；凹痕（读作/in,dent/）;【计〗缩进 词根助记in进入+ dent牙齿，咬合→指古代锯齿状凹痕的文书→indent（书写）缩排，印刷 v.（书写）缩排，印刷It’s a regulation to indent the first sentence of a paragraph when writing an article.在写文章时，缩进段落的第一句话是一种规则。 08 cane [ˈkæps.lɒkˌkiː] n. 甘蔗；手杖；藤条；茎;【护〗拐杖；v. 用藤条鞭打 联想助记你可以（can）嚼”甘蔗”（cane）。 n. 甘蔗This sugar cane is quite sweet and juicy.这甘蔗既甜又多汁。 … the manufacturing process for making sugar from sugar cane.…用甘蔗制糖的生产过程。来源：剑16 Test2 写作 n.手杖., concealed inside hollow bamboo walking canes.隐藏在中空的竹手杖内。来源：剑11 Test3 阅读 n.藤条… hide silkworm eggs in canes 。.把蚕卵藏在藤条里…..来源：剑11 Test3 阅读 09 serenity [ˌsaɪ.ə.miːzˈtwɪnz] n. 平静 词根助记serene宁静的+ity表名词→ serenity平静 n. 平静I meditate in pursuit of relaxation, serenity, and calmness of mind.我冥想来追求心灵的放松，宁静和平和。 10 forensic [fəˈren.zɪk] adj. 法医的，法庭的，辩论的；n. 辩论练习；辩论学，辩论术 词根助记forensi=拉丁语forensis论坛+ ic与….有关→forensic科学手段的，法庭的，辩论的 adj. 法医的，法庭的，辩论的Forensic scientists can determine a person’s sex and race by examining the blood.法医可以通过检测血液确定一个人的性别和种族。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-103
content: 01 vomit [ˈvɒm.ɪt $ ˈvɑː.mɪt] v. 呕吐；涌出；吐出；喷出；n.呕吐物，呕吐 联想助记vom呕吐的声音+it 东西→把东西”呕吐”(vomit)出来→“呕吐物”(vomit) v. 呕吐He isn’t really vomiting; it’s just an eye trick.他不是真吐了，这只是障眼法。 02 triumphant [traɪˈʌm.fənt] adj. 成功的；得胜的，得意洋洋的 词根助记triumph成功+ant形容词后缀→triumphant成功的 adj. 成功的He emerged triumphant in the September election.他在九月份的选举中大获全胜。 .., Marie Curie made a triumphant journey to the United States to raise funds for research on radium.居里夫人前往美国成功地为镭的研究筹集了资金。来源：剑9 Test4 阅读 03 mortal [ˈmɔːtl] adj. 必有一死的；致命的；极端的；n. 凡人，人类 词根助记mort死+ al形容词后缀→会死的→mortal必有一死的 adj. 必有一死的Man is mortal; we all must die.人终有一死，我们都是如此。 04 eddy [ˈed.i] n. 漩涡；v. 起漩涡；旋转 象形助记 n. 漩涡The little boat was almost caught in the eddy.小船差点被卷入漩涡。 05 depreciate [dɪˈpriː.ʃi.eɪt] v. 贬值；贬低，轻视；折旧 词根助记de下+ preci价值+ ate动词后缀→看不起价值→depreciate贬值 v. 贬值The US dollar has depreciated significantly; it is not as valuable as it used to be.美元已明显贬值，不像以前那么值钱了。 06 redundancy [rɪˈdʌn.dənt.si] n. 裁员；冗余；【财】裁员 词根助记red=re反复+ und波动+ ancy名词后缀→反复波动→redundancy冗余 n. 裁员Thousands of factory workers are facing redundancy.数千名工厂工人面临裁员。 History is clear that change can mean redundancies.历史清楚地表明，变革可能意味着裁员。来源：剑16 Test1 阅读 07 cosmos [ˈkəʊ.stɑːr $ ˈkoʊ.stɑːr] n. 宇宙，秩序；大波斯菊 词根助记cosm秩序+os名词后缀→古希腊人认为宇宙是规律运转的，引申为宇宙→cosmos宇宙，秩序 n.宇宙，秩序I would explore the cosmos in a spaceship if I could.如果可以的话，我想乘宇宙飞船探索宇宙。 But such transits have paved the way for what might prove to be one of the most vital breakthroughs in the cosmos …但这样的凌日现象为可能被证明是宇宙中最重要的突破之一铺平了道路来源：剑9 Test2 阅读 08 hectare [ˈhekteə(r)] n. 公顷 (等于1万平方米) 词根助记hect=希腊语hekaton一百+ are=area面积→hectare公顷 (等于1万平方米) n. 公顷 (等于1万平方米)There are six hectares of rice fields here.这里的稻田占地六公顷。 It covered a region of 16 hectares and was surrounded by a wall 10.5 meters high.它占地16公顷，周围有一堵10.5米高的墙。来源：剑16 Test1 阅读 09 fortitude [ˌfɔːtˈnɒks $ ˌfɔːrtˈnɑːks] n. 坚强意志（精神），坚忍，刚毅 词根助记fort力量+itude名词后缀，表示特性→fortitude坚强意志（精神），坚忍，刚毅 n.坚强意志（精神），坚忍，刚毅A lot of fortitude is required to meditate under a waterfall.要想在瀑布下打坐数小时，你需要足够的坚强意志。 10 potion [ˈpəʊʃn] n. 毒药，魔药；一剂，一服 象形助记 n. 毒药，魔药Take these magical potions to make yourself lucky.拿着这些魔法药剂吧，它们能让你变得幸运。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-102
content: 01 doctrine [ˈdɒk.trɪn $ ˈdɑːk-] n. 教条，学说，信条，原则;【财】法律原则，教条 词根助记doctr教+ ine名词后缀，人或物→教的东西→doctrine教义，教条 n. 教条，学说，信条，原则The girl is transcribing the doctrine from that book.这个女孩正在抄写那本书中的教义。 02 condemnation [ˌkɒn.dəmˈneɪ.ʃən $ ˌkɑːn-] n. 谴责，定罪 词根助记condemn责备，判刑+ation表名词→condemnation谴责，定罪 n. 谴责，定罪The criminal received widespread condemnation for committing the crime.这名罪犯因所犯罪行受到了普遍的谴责。 03 trite [traɪt] adj. 陈腐的，平庸的；老一套的 adj. 陈腐的，平庸的Giving red roses on Valentine’s Day is such a trite opinion!情人节送红玫瑰真是太老套了！ 04 pester [ˈpes.tər $ -tɚ] v. 使烦恼，纠缠 象形助记 v. 使烦恼，纠缠He gets fed up with people pestering him with annoying messages.他烦透了那些用短信缠着他的人。 05 ironical [aɪˈrɒnɪk] adj. 反讽的;=ironic.;讽刺的 词根助记irony讽刺+ical表形容词→ironical讽刺的 adj. 反讽的It’s ironical that the bird is standing on the “no bird” sign.讽刺的是，这只鸟正好站在“禁鸟”牌子上。 06 granular [ˈɡræn.jʊ.lər $ -jə.lɚ] adj. 粒状的，含颗粒的 象形助记 adj. 粒状的，含颗粒的These two piles of sugar and sand are both granular.这两堆糖和沙子都是颗粒状的。 07 extinguish [ɪkˈstɪŋ.ɡwɪʃ] v. 熄灭，扑灭；根除，消灭;【财】清偿 词根助记ex出+ stingu扑灭，熄灭+ish表动词→把（火）扑灭→extinguish熄灭；根除 v. 熄灭，扑灭Quickly, extinguish the fire before it grows!快点，趁火势变大之前扑灭它。 08 dangle [ˈdæŋɡl] v.悬挂，摇摆，使晃动；n.摇摆；摇摆物 v. 悬挂，摇摆，使晃动The beautiful diamond earrings dangle from her ears.她的耳朵上挂着漂亮的钻石耳环。 09 amiable [ˈeɪmiəbl] adj. 和蔼的，亲切的；温和的 词根助记ami=am爱+ able….的→能[被]爱的→ amiable亲切的，和蔼的，友善的 adj. 和蔼的，亲切的Airline flight attendants must always appear amiable and always keep smiling.空乘人员必须随时都很亲切，必须要保持微笑。 10 armour [ˈɑː.mər $ ˈɑːr.mɚ] n. 盔甲 词根助记arm武器装备+our集体名词→武装我们→armour盔甲 n. 盔甲Her metal armour protects her from attacks.她的金属盔甲保护着她不受攻击。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-101
content: 01 fluorescent [flʊəˈres.ənt $ flʊ-] adj. 荧光的；莹光的 象形助记 adj. 荧光的Fluorescent color catches the eye at the very first glance.荧光色能在第一眼就抓住眼球。 02 ballot [ˈbæl.ət] n.投票表决；选票；投票总数；vi.通过投票决定；vt. 使投票表决 联想助记（ball）“球”+（lot）“一大堆”=这次”选票表决”(ballot）采用的方式是往箱子里放不记名的小球。 n. 投票表决He voted in the ballot.他在选票中投了票。 03 adj. 无关紧要的，可忽略的，无意义的 象形助记 adj. 无关紧要的，可忽略的，无意义的His investment in the project was obviously insignificant.他在这个项目上的投资显然微不足道。 ., however small and seemingly insignificant, …·····.·无论多么渺小，多么微不足道，来源：剑14 Test3 阅读 04 rally [ˈræm.ə.dæn $ ˌræm.əˈdɑːn] n. 集会;（汽车、摩托车等的）拉力赛；v. 恢复（健康等），重新振作；集合；价格回升，反弹 词根助记r=re再次+ ally联盟→从分散到集中→rally集合，集会 n. 集会He has organized a public rally.他组织了一场群众集会。 05 lark [lɑːk $ lɑːrk] n. 云雀，玩笑，嬉耍；云雀；v. 嬉耍，玩乐 象形助记 n. 云雀，玩笑，嬉要This morning I woke up to the sound of larks singing.今早我一醒来就听到百灵鸟的吟唱。 06 salability [səˈlɑːm] n. 适销性 词根助记sale出售+ability表名词，“能..”→能够出售→salability适销性 n. 适销性Products working with other brands have the most salability.联名产品的适销性最高。 07 famine [ˈfæmɪn] n. 饥荒；严重的缺乏 词根助记fam饿+ ine表名词→会挨饿→famine饥荒 n.饥荒These poor African kids suffer a lot from famine.这些可怜的非洲儿童饱受饥荒之苦。 But the price of sudden climate change, in famine, disease and suffering, was often high.但是，突如其来的气候变化带来的饥荒、疾病和苦难的代价往往是高昂的。来源：剑8 Test2 阅读 08 fuse [fjuːz] v. 熔合，合并;(使）熔断；n. 导火线，引信；保险丝;【物】保险丝 联想助记保险丝（fuse）会熔化，熔合（fuse) v.熔合，合并Manufactured glass is made by fusing various types of sand.人造玻璃是通过熔合不同种类的沙子制造出来的。 … wanted to revolutionise popular music with songs that fused black and white music, and country and blues.他想用融合了黑人和白人音乐、乡村音乐和布鲁斯音乐的歌曲来革新流行音乐。来源：剑10 Test1 阅读 09 furor [ ] n. 轰动；狂热；激怒;感动 象形助记n. 轰动His campaign speech created a huge furor.他的竞选演讲引起了巨大的轰动。 10 enchant [ɪnˈtʃɑːnt] v. 施魔法于；吸引；使着迷 词根助记en进入，使+chant唱歌→像唱歌一样念咒语→enchant施魔法于 v. 施魔法于You’ll have to enchant the ball with a magic spell before you can use it.在你使用魔法球之前，你必须用口诀对其施展魔法。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-100
content: 01 toll [təʊl] n.损害；伤亡人数;（道路等的）通行费；钟声；v.敲钟 n. 损害The overuse of plastic products takes a toll on the environment.塑料产品的过度使用对环境造成了严重损害。 Massive floods, long droughts, hurricanes and severe monsoons take their toll each year, destroying millions of tons of valuable crops.大规模的洪水、长期干旱、飓风和严重的季风每年都会造成损失，摧毁数百万吨有价值的作物。来源：剑11 Test1 阅读 02 thrift [θrɪft] n. 节俭，节约；繁茂 联想助记繁荣兴盛（thrive）还是需要”节俭”（thrift） n. 节俭，节约The woman is buying clothes at a thrift store.这位女士正在二手店买衣服。 03 septic [ˌsaɪ.ə.miːzˈtwɪnz] adj. 受感染的，败血症的，腐败的；n. 引起腐败的东西；腐败物 词根助记sept烂+ic形容词后缀→ septic腐烂的，受感染的 adj. 受感染的，败血症的，腐败的His body is septic from the infection in his blood.他身体的感染是从血液感染得来的。 04 amplification [ˌæm.plɪ.fɪˈkeɪ.ʃən] n. 放大，扩大（力量，声音等）；详述 词根助记ampl放大+ if表动词+ cation名词后缀→amplification放大，扩大(力量，声音等) n. 放大，扩大(力量，声音等)Loudspeakers provide amplification of the user’s voice.扩音器能放大使用者的声音。 05 repertoire [ˈrepətwɑː(r)] n.全部才能;（剧团、演员等的）全部节目 象形助记 n. 全部才能She has a large repertoire of skills.她的才能多种多样。 … build a repertoire of creative problem-solving skills, and so much more..建立创造性的解决问题的全部技能等。来源：剑14 Test3 阅读 n.（剧团、演员等的）全部节目…’so the kid then has a wider repertoire of kinds of speech to practice,’ says VanDam.…这样孩子就有了更广泛的演讲曲目。来源：剑13 Test3 阅读 06 pellet [ˈpel.ət] n. 颗粒状物；小球；小子弹 n. 颗粒状物This new policy will directly impact wood pellet producers.这项新政策将直接影响木屑颗粒生产商。 Rainbow Bee Eaters eat only insects, and cough up small bits of skeleton and other products in a pellet.彩虹蜂只吃昆虫，咳出的食物颗粒中有少量动物骨架和其他东西。来源：剑8 Test2 听力 07 permeate [ˈpɜː.mi.eɪt $ ˈpɝː-] v. 弥漫；普及；渗透 联想助记permeate=每一块（per）我做（me）的蛋糕都”弥漫”着香味，让人忍不住想吃 (ate) v. 弥漫The sweet smell of the flowers permeated the entire room.花的香气弥漫了整个房间。 08 tare [ˈtɑː.di $ ˈtɑːr-] n. 皮重;；包装重量；野碗豆；草；vt.量皮重 n. 皮重This scale will automatically subtract the tare.这个秤会自动扣除皮重。 09 ostentation [ˌɒs.tenˈteɪ.ʃən $ ˌɑː.stən-] n. 卖弄，炫耀 象形助记 n. 卖弄，炫耀Ostentation is very important to a foolish person. The car shows that clearly.炫耀对一个愚蠢的人来说非常重要。这部车说明了一切。 10 ventilate [ˈven.tɪ.leɪt $ -t̬əl.eɪt] v. 使….通风，透风；公开讨论 词根助记ventil =vent风 + ate使之成….→ ventilate使….通风 v.使….通风，．透风She opened the window to ventilate the house.她打开窗户为房子通风。 .., the entire building is naturally ventilated,..····整个建筑都是自然通风的，来源：剑14 Test2 阅读
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-099
content: 01 stain [steɪn] v. 弄脏；玷污；染色；n.污渍，污迹；染色；染料，着色剂 联想助记sta=stay，停留+in里面=“污渍”会停留在衣服里面，洗不出来。 v. 弄脏；玷污；染色His clothing is stained with ketchup.他的衣服被番茄酱弄脏了。 They were used to stain previously invisible microbes and bacteria …它们用来给以前看不见的微生物和细菌染色来源：剑9 Test1 阅读 02 distend [dɪˈstend] v. 膨胀；胀大；扩张 词根助记dis分开+tend伸展→伸展开→distend膨胀 v.膨胀The balloon fills up with gas and distends.气球内部填满气体膨胀起来。 In terms of feeding, it was exclusively carnivorous, and its stomach was muscular with an ability to distend在进食方面，它完全是肉食性的，它的胃是肌肉发达的，能够膨胀..来源：剑17 Test3 阅读 03 herbal [ˈhɜːbl] adj 药草的，香草的；n. (草本)植物志 谐音助记herbal谐音：喝不“药草的”汤，喝不？ adj. 药草的，香草的The ingredients of herbal medicine all come from plants.草药的成分都来源于植物。 Its leaves and bark were used for herbal remedies, …它的叶子和树皮被用来做草药治疗，来源：剑15 Test4 阅读 04 carnivore [ˈkɑː.nɪ.vɔːr $ ˈkɑːr.nɪ.vɔːr] n. 食肉动物，食虫植物 词根助记carn肉+vor吃+e→食肉动物，食虫植物 n.食肉动物，食虫植物Eagles are carnivores: they only eat meat.雕是食肉动物，它们只吃肉。 There is no carnivore now in Tasmania that fills the niche which thylacines once occupied.现在塔斯马尼亚没有食肉动物可以填补袋狼曾经占据的位置。来源：剑15 test2 阅读 05 aptitude [ˈæptɪtjuːd] n. 天资；自然倾向；适宜;【财】天资，才能 象形助记 n. 天资He has an excellent aptitude for science.他对科学展现出了优异的天资。 .. linguistic factors influence how we judge personality, intelligence, social status, educational standards, job aptitude…·语言因素影响我们判断人格、智力、社会地位、教育水平、工作能力的方式…来源：剑9 Test3 阅读 06 tibia [ˈtɪbiə] n. 胫骨；胫节；从前的一种笛 n. 胫骨The dark parts in this X-ray picture are the tibias.这张X光片中深色的部分是胫骨。 07 eucalyptus [ˌjuːkəˈlɪptəs] n.桉树 n.桉树This is a giant eucalyptus tree.这是一棵巨大的桉树。 The thylacine appeared to occupy most types of terrain except dense rainforest, with open eucalyptus forest thought to be its prime habitat.袋狼似乎占据了除了茂密雨林以外的大多数地形，人们认为开阔的桉树林是它的主要栖息地。来源：剑17 Test3 阅读 08 mania [mɑːtʃ $ mɑːrtʃ] n. 癫狂，狂热 n. 癫狂，狂热His mania for collecting stamps has taken over his entire life.他对集邮的狂热已经占据了他整个生活。 09 chant [tʃɑːnt $ tʃænt] n.圣歌，赞美诗；吟诵声；重复的话语；v.反复地说；吟诵；(有节奏地、反复地)唱；咏唱 象形助记 n. 圣歌，赞美诗They are singing Christmas chants.他们在唱圣诞颂歌。 Such chemical communication can be compared to the human use of visual and auditory channels as in religious chants,…这种化学交流可以比作人类在宗教圣歌中使用的视觉和听觉渠道，来源：剑7 Test3 阅读 10 subtle [ˈsʌt.l̩ $ ˈsʌt̬-] adj. 不明显的，微妙的；精巧的，精妙的；敏锐的；精细的；狡猾的；精湛的；难以捉摸的 词根助记sub在…下面+ tle网→在网下面→ subtle不明显的 adj. 不明显的，微妙的There is a subtle change in his weight.他的体重有细微的变化。 The effects of sound are often largely subtle and often are noted by only our subconscious minds.声音的影响在很大程度上是微妙的，往往只被我们的潜意识所注意到。来源：剑11 Test4 阅读 adj. 精巧的，精妙的Others, though, are fascinated by the prospect that a computer might create something as original and subtle as our best artists.然而，另一些人则对这样的前景着迷：计算机可能和我们最好的艺术家一样，创造出具有原创性、精巧的东西。来源：剑13 Test1 阅读
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-098
content: 01 delude [dɪˈluːd] v. 欺骗，哄骗 词根助记de下+lude玩→骗他下去玩→delude欺骗 v. 欺骗，哄骗This gesture symbolizes deluding others.这个手势象征着欺骗他人。 We should never delude ourselves into believing…我们决不应该欺骗自己去相信.来源：剑8 Test3 阅读 02 snap [snæp] v. 使咔嘧一声折断，吧嗒关上或打开；拍照，摄影；打响指；n.吧嗒声；快照；响指；adj. 仓促的 象形助记 v. 使咔嘧一声折断，吧嗒关上或打开He was so angry that he snapped the pencil in two.他太生气了，把铅笔咔嚓折成了两半。 03 tumour [ˈtjuː.mər $ ˈtuː.mɚ] n. 肿瘤 词根助记tum肿+our表名词→肿起来的地方→tumour肿瘤 n. 肿瘤A tumour is a mass of diseased or abnormal cells growing in a person’s body.肿瘤是长在人体内的一块病变或异常的细胞。 Facial tumour syndrome which threatens the existence of…面部肿瘤综合症威胁到来源：剑15 test2 阅读 04 provocation [ˌprɒv.əˈkeɪ.ʃən $ ˌprɑː.və-] n. 挑衅，挑拨，激怒 词根助记provoke激怒，挑畔+(ca)tion名词后缀→provocation激怒，挑 n. 挑衅，挑拨，激怒His constant provocation caused them to fight all the time.他经常性的挑衅总是引起他们的争斗。 05 heartfelt [ˈhɑːtfelt] adj. 真心真意的；诚挚的；衷心的 词根助记heart心+felt感觉→用心感觉的→heartfelt真心真意的 adj. 真心真意的Love is a heartfelt emotion.爱是一种真挚的情感。 06 plateau [ˌpleɪt.tekˈtɒn.ɪks $ ˈtɑːn-] n. 高原;(不再有变化或进展的）稳定阶段；vi.到达平稳阶段 词根助记plat平坦+ eau表名词→平坦地→ plateau平顶；高原 n. 高原The view from the plateau is absolutely breathtaking.高原有着极美的景色。 Cusco lies on a high plateau at an elevation of more than 3,000 metres, ..库斯科位于海拔3000多米的高原上，来源：剑12 Test6 阅读 07 distort [dɪˈstɔːt $ -ˈstɔːrt] v. 扭曲，使变形；歪曲，曲解 词根助记dis分离+tort变形，扭曲→ distort扭曲 v. 扭曲，使变形Somebody is distorting the real image using a mirror.有人用镜子把真实的图像扭曲了。 … work inspired him to distort the human body in a radical way..的作品启发他以一种激进的方式扭曲人体。来源：剑15 Test3 阅读 v. 歪曲，曲解The tyranny of quarterly reporting can distort board decision-making,…季度报告好看与否凌驾于一切之上，这可能会歪曲董事会的决策行为，。··来源：剑12 Test8 阅读 08 tanker [ˈtæŋ.kər $ -kɚ] n. 油轮；运油飞机；油槽车；坦克手 词根助记tank油、水箱+er施动者名词后缀，表示”人或物”→装油的事物→tanker油轮 n. 油轮The tanker is transporting crude oil across the sea to its destination.这艘油轮正将原油运到大海对面的目的地。 … such as a tanker accidentally spilling its whole cargo of oil ……比如一艘油轮意外地泄漏了整个石油货物…来源：剑14 Test4 阅读 09 paraphrase [ˈpær.ə.freɪz $ ˈper-] v. 解释，释义；n. 转述，释义 词根助记para辅助+phrase说，表达→辅助表达→paraphrase解释，释义 v. 解释，释义To paraphrase the famous saying, success comes from failure.这句名言的意思是说，成功源于失败。 10 intimidate [ɪnˈtɪmɪdeɪt] v. 恐吓，威胁 词根助记in使+ timid害怕的+ ate使…→使人胆小→intimidate恐吓 v. 恐吓，威胁The girl drew out her sword to intimidate the boy.女孩拔出剑来吓唬男孩。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-097
content: 01 perpendicular [ˌpɜː.pənˈdɪk.jʊ.lər $ ˌpɝː.pənˈdɪk.juː.lɚ] adj. 成直角的，垂直的；直立的;【物】垂直的；【数】垂直的；n. 垂直线 词根助记per全部+pend挂+ ular表形容词→全部挂起来的→perpendicular成直角的，垂直的 adj. 成直角的，垂直的The two lines are perpendicular to one another.这两条线互相垂直。 02 wane [weɪn] v. 减少;（光、势力、治理等）衰落；（月）缺损；n.衰退（期）；月亏（期）；减少 词根助记wan(van)空+e动词后缀→使变空，减少→wane减少，（光、势力、治理等）衰落 v. 减少Our profits have waned every year, and now we’re out of money.利润每年都在减少，现在我们已经没钱了。 03 obscene [əbˈsiːn] adj. 下流的，淫秽的 词根助记ob相反+ scene舞台→舞台后的，见不得人的→obscene下流的，淫秽的 adj. 下流的，淫秽的This person’s obscene gesture annoyed the other person.这个人下流的手势让对方感到恼火。 04 turbot [ˈtɜː.bət $ ˈtɝː-] n.大菱（产于欧洲的一种可食用比目鱼）；比目鱼之类 n.大菱 (产于欧洲的一种可食用比目鱼)Turbot is a type of flat fish living in European seas.大菱鲆是一种生活在欧洲海域的扁平海鱼。 05 prophet [ˈprɒf.ɪt $ ˈprɑː.fɪt] n. 先知，预言者 词根助记pro在前+ phet=phanai说出→能提前说出的人→prophet先知，预言者 n. 先知，预言者The prophet said he would have a bad day.这位先知说他（包大人）今天（印堂发黑）运势不佳。 06 embroider [ɪmˈbrɔɪ.dər $ -dɚ] v. 刺绣，绣花；润色，渲染 词根助记em进入，使+broid，词源同braid编织→embroider刺绣 v. 刺绣，绣花The white cloth is embroidered with a design of a tree.白布上绣有树木的图案。 07 inflammable [ɪnˈflæməbl] adj.可燃的，易激怒的；n.易燃物 词根助记in加强意义+flam燃烧,火焰+ able形容词后缀→inflammable可燃的，易激怒的 adj. 可燃的，易激怒的Put your cigarette out! That oil is inflammable.把你的烟灭了！油是易燃物。 08 raucous [ˈrɔː.kəs $ ˈrɑː-] adj.（声音）沙哑的，刺耳的，吵闹的 词根助记来自拉丁语raucus沙哑声→raucous沙哑的 adj．（声音）沙哑的，刺耳的，吵闹的The terrible rock band made raucous noise for hours.那个糟糕的乐队制造了数小时刺耳的声音。 09 lime [laɪm] n（生）石灰，氧化钙；酸橙；【植】树，菩提树；v.用石灰处理；撒（刷、涂上、加）石灰；adj. 石灰的；绿黄色的 词根助记词根来自拉丁语limus,污泥，黏质物→lime（生）石灰，氧化钙 n.（生）石灰，氧化钙Acidity in soil can be neutralized by spreading lime on it.土壤的酸性可以通过在它上面撒石灰来中和。 A mixture of sand, soda ash and lime.沙子、纯碱和石灰的混合物。来源：剑8 Test2 阅读 10 insane [ɪnˈseɪn] adj. 精神失常的，疯狂的；精神病患者的；荒唐的；n.精神失常的人；精神错乱的人 词根助记in不+ sane健康的→头脑不清的→insane精神失常的 adj. 精神失常的，疯狂的The mental patient is totally insane because he imagines himself as a dog.这个精神病人已经完全疯了，因为他把自己想象成一条狗。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-096
content: 01 tetrad [ˌteksˈmeks] n. 四个一组；四位组；四分体；四元基 词根助记tetr四+ ad后缀→tetrad四个一组 n. 四个一组These apples come in groups of tetrad.这些苹果四个一组。 02 par [pəˈpaɪə.rəs $ -ˈpaɪ-] n. 同等，等位，常态，票面价值，【体】标准杆数；adj 票面的，平常的，标准的 词根助记par相等→par同等 n.同等，等位，常态，票面价值，【体】标准杆数The four major classical novels are on par with each other in Chinese literary circles.四大名著在中国文学界中同彼此齐名。 03 supersede [ˌsuːpəˈsiːd] v. 代替；紧接着而到来;【法】替代 词根助记super在上，上方+sed坐→ supersede代替，取代 v. 代替Robots superseding humans at playing Go has become a reality.机器人替代真人下围棋已成为现实。 .. and was eventually superseded by the rise of trade in coffee, tea, chocolate, and sugar.最终被咖啡、茶、巧克力和糖贸易的兴起所取代。来源：剑13 Test2 阅读 04 lull [lʌl] v. 使平静，使安静，哄骗；n. 间歇，暂停，暂时平静 谐音助记拉儿→拉着儿子的小手使他安静 v. 使平静，使安静，哄骗Mom sang a song to lull the baby to sleep.妈妈唱了首歌，让孩子进入梦乡。 05 cram [kræm] v. 塞满；猛吃;；仓促备考；挤满 象形助记v.塞满；猛吃 Being hungry for the whole morning, I couldn’t help but cram food into my mouth.我饿了一上午，禁不住狼吞虎咽了起来。 … opening the way to the design of compression methods that cram maximum information into the minimum space..开辟了一条设计出的简练方法的道路，将最大限度的信息填充到最小的空间。来源：剑9 Test3 阅读 06 plank [plæŋk] n. 厚木板；木板制成物；政纲条款；要点；平板支撑；板条；v.在.上铺板；砰一声放下；用菜板端出 象形助记 n. 厚木板Wooden planks are often used to build doors.木板常常被用来建造房门。 Skilled craftsmen were needed for the mortise and tenon method of fixing planks.固定木板的卯方法需要熟练的工匠。来源：剑16 Test3 阅读 07 convict [kənˈvɪkt] n. 犯人(读作/“kan,vikt/)（经审讯）证明…有罪，使….知罪（读作/kan’v1kt/) 词根助记con一起+vict=conquer征服→一起征服的对象→convict犯人 n. 犯人(读作/“kan,vikt/)The convict is in prison for some pretty terrible crimes.这个犯人因为一些很严重的罪行而入狱。 08 infantry [ˈɪnfəntri] n. 步兵，步兵团 词根助记infant婴儿+ry表名词→婴儿不会说话，步兵地位低，不能说话只能服从命令→infantry步兵 n. 步兵，步兵团The infantry are trained in winter to adapt to the cold.步兵在冬天接受训练以适应寒冷环境。 09 mast [mɑːst $ mæst] n. 桅，桅杆，柱；旗杆；天线竿；v.装桅杆于 象形助记 n.栀，栀杆，柱The mast is stable enough to withstand the strong storm.这根桅杆非常稳固，足以抵御强风暴。 They had from one to three masts with large square sails他们有一到三根挂着大方帆的栀杆来源：剑16 Test3 阅读 10 endeavour [ɪnˈdevə(r)] n.尝试，努力，尽力（=endeavour)；v.努力，尽力 词根助记en=in进入，在内+ deavor责任，债务→在责任、债务里→endeavor努力 n. 尝试，努力，尽力（=endeavour)It’s an endeavor for the ant to carry the food back into the cave.蚂蚁要付出巨大的努力才能把食物搬回洞中。 .. in many other realms of human endeavor...．人类努力的许多其他领域。来源：剑17 Test2 阅读
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-095
content: 01 finicky [ˈfɪn.ɪ.ki] adj. 苛求的，过分讲究的 词根助记finick吹毛求疵+ y形容词后缀→吹毛求疵的→finicky过分讲究的 adj. 苛求的，过分讲究的My daughter is so finicky about her food! She never eats my cooking.我女儿超级挑食！她从不吃我做的菜。 02 notoriety [ˌnəʊtəˈraɪəti] n. 声名狼籍；臭名昭著，声名狼藉；恶名 词根助记not知道，认识，注意+ ori+ ety名词词尾→不好的名声都知道→notoriety声名狼藉 n. 声名狼籍He achieved notoriety by negative reviews from the customers.他通过客户的负面评价而声名狼藉。 While suggestopedia has gained some notoriety through success in the teaching of modern languages ..虽然 suggestopedia 因在现代语言教学中的成功而声名狼藉…….来源：剑7Test1 阅读 03 articulate [ɑːˈtɪk.jʊ.lət $ ɑːr-] v. 明确表达；清晰地发音；连接，接合；与…合成整体，使相互连贯(读作/ar’trkju,lert/)；adj.善于表达的；发音清晰的（读作/artrkjulrt/）；可听懂的 词根助记articul技巧，关节，诡计+ate表形容词→说话有技巧→articulate明确表达 v. 明确表达He articulated his dislike for overworking.他明确表示不喜欢加班。 When I ask fire science students to articulate the end, or purpose, of their field, they eventually generalize to something like,…当我让消防科学专业的学生说明他们所在领域的目标或目的时，他们最终概括为…来源：剑12 Test5 阅读 adj. 善于表达的Its supporters are more articulate.其支持者则更加善于表达。来源：剑12 Test8 阅读 04 detest [dɪˈtest] vt. 厌恶，憎恨，痛恨 词根助记de不+test证据→不愿作证→detest厌恶 vt. 厌恶，憎恨，痛恨Apparently, she really detests doing chores.很明显，她非常讨厌做家务。 05 ornament [ˈɔː.nə.mənt $ ˈɔːr-] n. 装饰物，饰品（读作/ornamant/）；装饰，摆设；首饰；v. 装饰(读作/‘orna,ment/) 词根助记orn装饰+a+ment名词后缀→ornament装饰 n. 装饰物，饰品(读作/ornamant/)We put the Christmas ornaments on the tree every year.每年，我们都要在圣诞树上放上装饰品。 06 obstruction [əbˈstrʌkʃn] n. 阻碍，障碍物；堵塞 词根助记ob逆，倒+ struct建立+ion名词后缀→逆着建立→obstruction障碍 n. 阻碍，障碍物You can find another way around the obstruction in your path.前进路上遇到障碍物，你可以绕道而行。 Then, 0n 16 June 1836, some fishermen in the Solent found that their equipment was caught on an underwater obstruction,…1836年6月16日，索伦特的一些渔民发现他们的设备被一个水下障碍物绊住了来源：剑11 Test2 阅读 07 pivot [ˈpɪv.ət] n. 枢轴，中心;【物】支点；v.以..为中心转动；adj 枢轴的；关键的 联想助记飞行员（pilot）进行V形转向时有一个枢轴（pivot) n. 枢轴，中心“Give me a pivot and I can move the earth,” the scientist says.“给我一个支点，我可以撬动地球”，这位科学家说。 08 imperialist [ɪmˈpɪə.ri.ə.lɪst $ -ˈpɪr.i-] n. 帝国主义者；adj. 帝国主义的 词根助记imperial帝国的+ ist名词词尾,.者→ imperialist 帝国主义者 n.帝国主义者In the past, we were under imperialist oppression, and forced to sign unequal treaties.过去我们曾受帝国主义的压迫，被迫签订不平等条约。 09 affiliate [əˈfɪl.i.eɪt] n. 分公司，附属机构(读作/a’flirt/)；v.使隶属于；接纳；追溯；发生联系(读作/afliert/) 词根助记af朝，向，去+fil子女+ iate表动词→affliate分公司 n. 分公司，附属机构（读作/a’frlirt/)This company has established many affiliates over the years.这个集团这几年建立了许多分公司。 10 etiquette [ˈetɪket] n. 礼仪;（商务）礼仪 词根助记eti/ estiqu（源于古法语”estiquer”），意为”附加”或“插入”，表示与规则、规范相关的东西+ette（法语小词缀）表示”小的”或”轻微的”→etiquette“贴上的小规则”或”附加的小规范”，后引申为”礼仪”或”行为规范” n. 礼仪A firm handshake is important in business etiquette.有力的握手礼是重要的商务礼仪。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-094
content: 01 stow [stəʊ $ stoʊ] v. 装载，收藏，使暂留；n.斯托 谐音助记stow谐音：私自偷偷收藏-私偷 v. 装载，收藏，使暂留I’ll stow these old clothes away just in case my daughter wants them someday.我把这些旧衣服收起来放好，万一我女儿某天有需要。 02 aroma [əˈrəʊ.mə $ -ˈroʊ-] n. 芳香，香气 象形助记 n. 芳香，香气They are enjoying the aroma of the wine before drinking it.这两个人喝酒前正在体会红酒的香气。 … we breathe in the aromas which surround us without being consciously aware of their importance to us.我们吸入了周围的香味，却没有意识到它们对我们的重要性。来源：剑8 Test2 阅读 03 pastry [ˈpeɪstri] n. 糕点，点心；面糊 象形助记 n. 糕点，点心I love the pastries so much. I’ll eat them all!我特别喜欢这些糕点。我要把它们全部吃完！ 04 boycott [ˈbɔɪ.kɒt $ -kɑːt] vt.抵制；n.抵制 联想助记买（buy）+切（cut）=”抵制”购买，切断货源 vt. 抵制He urged people to boycott child labor in his speech.他在演讲中呼吁人们抵制童工。 This has led to some radical questions among environmentalists, such as whether consumers should try to boycott palm oil entirely.这在环保主义者中引发了一些激进的问题，例如消费者是否应该尝试完全抵制棕榈油。来源：剑17 Test3 阅读 n. 抵制One response to the boycott movement has been the argument for the vital role palm oil plays …对抵制运动的一种回应是对棕榈油发挥重要作用的争论..来源：剑17 Test3 阅读 05 candid [ˈkæps.lɒkˌkiː] adj. 率直的；坦白的；无偏见的；公正的 词根助记cand白+id→白的→ candid坦白的 adj. 率直的He was very candid with his friends; he directly expressed his opinion.他对自己的朋友很率直，有什么话都会直说。 06 pretext [ˈpriː.tekst] n. 借口，托词 词根助记pre预先+text编织→预先编好的→pretext借口 n. 借口，托词The pupil asked for leave on the pretext of having a stomachache.这个小学生以肚子疼为借口请假。 07 repudiate [rɪˈpjuː.di.eɪt] v. 拒绝，否定，驳斥;【财】拒绝;【法】拒绝履行 词根助记re反+pud羞耻+ iate表动词+反过来让对方羞耻+repudiate否定，驳斥，拒绝， v. 拒绝，否定，驳斥She did not like the terms that were presented, so she repudiated the agreement.她不满意所提出的条款，所以拒绝这份合约。 08 intersection [ˌɪntəˈsekʃn] n. 交点，十字路口;【计】交集；【数】交点，交集 词根助记intersect相交+ion名词后缀→相交的地方→intersection交点，十字路口 n. 交点，十字路口Meet me at the intersection of two streets.到两条街的十字路口来跟我碰头。 09 submerge [səbˈmɜːdʒ $ -ˈmɝːdʒ] v. 沉没，淹没；遮掩 词根助记sub在下面+merge沉，没→淹没下去→submerge淹没 v. 沉没，淹没The car was almost submerged by the floodwater!汽车就快被洪水淹没了！ Another slight concern is submerged debris floating into the blades.另一个小问题是漂浮在叶片中的水下碎片。来源：剑9 Test3 阅读 10 filth [fɪlθ] n. 污物；污秽图片；对警察的冒犯言辞 象形助记 n.污物The room is full of trash and filth.这个房间满是垃圾和污物。 The faecal filth of salmon farming has driven wild salmon from many of the sea lochs and rivers of Scotland.鲑鱼养殖场的粪便污物已将野生鲑鱼从苏格兰的许多海洋湖泊和河流中驱逐出去。来源：剑7 Test2 阅读
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-093
content: 01 residue [ˈrez.ɪ.djuː $ -ə.duː] n. 残渣；剩余物；渣；残数;【化】残渣，剩余，滤渣；【电】留数 词根助记re回+ sid坐+ue →（不能用）重新坐回来→residue残余，残渣 n. 残渣The snail left a trail of sticky residue everywhere it moved.蜗牛无论走到哪里都会留下一道黏稠的残渣。 02 profess [prəˈfes] v. 表示，承认；宣称 词根助记pro在前面+fess说→在前面说→profess表示，承认 v. 表示，承认They publicly professed their love for each other.他们公开承认了对彼此的爱。 03 torment [ˈtɔːment] n.苦痛；折磨；烦恼(读作/tor,ment/)；vt.使苦恼；折磨(读作/torment/) 词根助记tor扭曲+ment表名词→扭到了很痛→torment苦痛 n. 苦痛He suffered the torment of his colleague’s abuse.他经受了同事们攻击带来的苦痛。 04 cosmopolitan [ˈkəʊ.stɑːr $ ˈkoʊ.stɑːr] adj. 国际性的；广泛分布的；见多识广的；n.游历四方的人 词根助记cosmo世界+polit城市+ an关于→关于世界城市的→cosmopolitan国际性的 adj. 国际性的London is a cosmopolitan city; people here are from various countries.伦敦是一个国际大都市；这里的人来自不同国家。 05 tropic [ˈtrɒp.ɪk $ ˈtrɑː.pɪk] n.热带，回归线；adj. 热带的 词根助记trop转+ic表名词→太阳回转的地方→tropic回归线 n. 热带，回归线The tropics are home to many rainforests.热带地区雨林广布。 … might affect rainfall patterns across the tropics and the Southern Ocean...可能会影响热带和南大洋的降雨模式。来源：剑11 Test1 阅读 06 subsidy [ˈsʌb.sɪ.di] n. 补助金，津贴 词根助记subsid减弱+y名词后缀→拨款以减低公共事业消费→ subsidy补助金 n. 补助金，津贴The government provided a subsidy for the entrepreneurs.政府为创业者提供了补贴。 Studies show that sixty percent of beneficiaries of subsidies are not poor …研究表明，60%的补贴受益者不是穷人..来源：剑12 Test6 阅读 07 indebted [ɪnˈdetɪd] adj. 感激的；负债的 联想助记欠人一笔债（debt），所以一定要感激(indebted) adj. 感激的The mother is deeply indebted to the police for finding her daughter.这位母亲非常感激警察帮她找到女儿。 08 granary [ˈɡræn.ər.i $ -ɚ-] n. 谷仓，粮仓；主要来源；产粮区 象形助记 n. 谷仓，粮仓A granary is a building which is used for storing grain.粮仓是用来储存粮食的建筑物。 09 renowned [rɪˈnaʊnd] adj. 著名的；有名的 词根助记renown名望，声誉+ed形容词后缀→renowned著名的 adj. 著名的The Eiffel Tower is renowned for its beauty and simplicity.埃菲尔铁塔以其美丽简约而著名。 In each set of trials, volunteers generally preferred the work of renowned artists …在每组试验中，志愿者通常更喜欢知名艺术家的作品..来源：剑11 Test2 阅读 10 tyrannical [tɪˈræn.ɪ.kəl] adj. 暴君的，专制的，残酷的 词根助记tyrant 暴君+ical形容词后缀→tyrannical暴君的 adj. 暴君的，专制的，残酷的People have to work day and night under the new king and his tyrannical regime.在新国王及其暴政下，人民需要日夜不停地劳作。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-092
content: 01 indebtedness [/ɪnˈdetɪdnəs/] n. 感激；债务；受恩惠；亏欠；负债 词根助记indebted感激的+ness名词后缀→感激之情→indebtedness感激 n. 感激She expressed her indebtedness to her mother by a card and hug.她用贺卡和拥抱表达了对妈妈的感激。 02 mend [mend] v. 修理，缝补；改正，改进；好转；治愈；n.痊愈；改进 联想助记门坏了，他弯腰(bend）修补(mend) v. 修理，缝补The man is trying to mend the damaged roof.这个男人正在尝试修补被损坏的屋顶。 03 indifferent [ɪnˈdɪfrənt] adj. 冷漠的;；不感兴趣的，不关心的；平庸的 词根助记in不+different不同的→相同还是不同无所谓→indifferent冷漠的 adj. 冷漠的He is indifferent to his wife. 他对他的妻子很冷漠。His team have recently identified five distinct types: indifferent, calibrating..他的团队最近确定了五种不同的类型：冷漠、校准.来源：剑13 Test1 阅读 04 paramount [ˈpær.ə.maʊnt $ ˈper-] adj. 最高的，至上的，首要的；n.最高；元首 词根助记para类似+ mount山 →类似高山→paramount最高的，至上的，首要的 adj. 最高的，至上的，首要的Leadership is of paramount importance in a team.在一个团队中，领导力至关重要。 05 terrestrial [təˈres.tri.əl] adj.地球的，陆地的；n.陆地生物；地球上的人 词根助记terr陆地+estr名词后缀+ial形容词后缀→terrestrial地球的，陆地的 adj. 地球的，陆地的I have learned a lot about the Earth’s geography from this terrestrial globe.我从地球仪上学到了许多关于地球的知识。 Insects are the undisputed masters of the terrestrial domain.昆虫是陆地上公认的大师。来源：剑14 Test3 阅读 06 sewer [ˌsaɪ.ə.miːzˈtwɪnz] n.排水沟，下水道，缝纫者；V.用下水道排污水；铺设污水管道 词根助记s-=ex出+ ew=aqu水+ er名词后缀→ sewer排水沟,下水道 n. 排水沟，下水道，缝纫者The city sewer system carries away waste to then be treated.城市下水道系统将废水排走，然后再进行处理。 … nine major systems, with an innovative layout of pipes and well-built sewers, supplied the occupants of Rome ……九个主要系统，以及创新的管道布局和建造精良的下水道，为罗马居民提供了来源：剑7 Test1 阅读 07 inexorable [ɪnˈeksərəbl] adj. 不为所动的，坚决不变的；n. 坚定不移的人 词根助记in不+ ex出 + or说+ able能….的→说不出妥协的话→inexorable不为所动的，坚决不变的 adj. 不为所动的，坚决不变的My inexorable teacher wouldn’t accept my excuse for the missing homework.我那态度坚决的老师不接受我没交作业的理由。 Although the same law holds for a living organism, the result of this law is not inexorable虽然同样的法则适用于生物体，但这一法则的作用结果并不是无法改变来源：剑8 Test3 阅读 08 downfall [ˈdaʊnfɔːl] n. 衰落的原因；垮台；暴雨 词根助记down下+fall落下→下落→downfall衰落的原因 n. 衰落的原因Greed was his downfall.贪得无厌就是他堕落的缘由。 The nineteenth century and industrialisation saw the downfall of the European silk industry.19世纪的工业化进程见证了欧洲丝绸业的衰落。来源：剑11 Test3 阅读 09 futures [ ] n. 期货 联想助记未来（future）的”期货”（futures） n. 期货‘Futures‘ are agreements to buy goods, and include a predetermined future date and price.期货是一种货物交易合同，并包含预先决定好的未来交付日期和价格。 10 beak [biːk] n.鸟嘴，喙 象形助记 n. 鸟嘴，喙This bird has a big orange beak.这只鸟有一个大大的、橙色的喙。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-091
content: 01 lest [lest] conj. 惟恐；以免；担心 词根助记les=less更少的 + t=the → the less that比…少 →lest唯恐，以免 conj.惟恐；以免；担心She set many alarms the previous night, lest she be late again.她睡前设了超多闹钟，以免再次迟到。 02 meek [miːk] adj. 温顺的，逆来顺受的；谦恭的；n.温顺的人；谦恭的人 象形助记 adj. 温顺的，逆来顺受的The sheep is very meek and won’t hurt you.绵羊很温顺，不会伤害人。 03 paranoia [ˌpær.əˈnɔɪ.ə $ ˌper-] n.（心理）偏执狂，多疑症 词根助记para在旁边，在周围+noia思想，想法→胡思乱想→paranoia偏执狂，多疑症 n.（心理）偏执狂，多疑症The man suffers from paranoia; he believes others are trying to harm him.这个男人有妄想症，他总以为其他人想伤害他。 04 relinquish [rɪˈlɪŋ.kwɪʃ] v. 放弃，让出（权利，财产等），撤回 词根助记re强调+linqu离开+ish表动词→离开不再要→relinquish放弃，让出 (权利，财产等) v. 放弃，让出（权利，财产等），撤回She relinquishes her inheritance rights to the house.她放弃了房子的继承权。 05 delinquent [dɪˈlɪŋ.kwənt] n.少年罪犯，违犯者；adj 不尽责的；怠工的;<美〉拖欠（税款）的 词根助记de一再+ linqu离开+ent→一再离开[正道]→有过失→ delinquent少年罪犯，违犯者 n.少年罪犯，违犯者This delinquent was arrested and the police took his photo.这个少年罪犯被拘捕了，警察给他拍了照片。 06 condolence [kənˈdəʊ.lənts $ -ˈdoʊ-] n. 哀悼；吊 词根助记condole 哀悼+ ence表名词→ condolence哀悼；吊喀 n.哀悼People lit candles to show their condolence for the earthquake victims.人们点燃蜡烛，来向地震中的受害者表示哀悼。 07 precipitate [prɪˈsɪp.ɪ.teɪt] adj 仓促的，贸然的，轻率的；感情用事的（读作/pri’sipatt/)【气象】凝结；促成，使…沉淀，猛摔；【化】使沉淀；n.沉淀物，冷凝物 词根助记pre…前的，预先+ cipit头 + ate做，造成→提前做→ precipitate促成 adj. 仓促的，贸然的，轻率的The precipitate opening of the car door caused a collision with the cyclist.车门突然打开，撞上了骑行者。 08 exertion [ɪɡˈzɜːʃn] n. 用力；运用 词根助记exert施加+ion表名词→施加力量→exertion用力 n.用力The man is breathless from the exertion of pulling the bike uphill.那人努力地把自行车往山上拉，累得气喘吁吁。 09 sarcastic [sɑːˈkæstɪk] adj. 讽刺的，挖苦的，冷嘲热讽的 词根助记sarcas=sarcasm讥讽 + tic..的→讥讽的 →sarcastic挖苦的；尖刻的，辛辣的 adj. 讽刺的，挖苦的，冷嘲热讽的She always talks to people in a sarcastic tone.她说话时总是阴阳怪气。 10 stationary [ˈsteɪʃənri] adj 静止的；固定的;【化】固定的;【物】静止的；n.定居者，驻军 词根助记station站立+ ary表形容词→站着不动→ stationary静止的 adj. 静止的The cars in the traffic jam are stationary.堵车了，车子都一动不动。 …like an enormous stationary pendulum.就像一个巨大的静止的钟摆。来源：剑7 Test2 阅读
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-090
content: 01 mangrove [mɑːtʃ $ mɑːrtʃ] n. 红树（一种热带树木，生于水中或水边，并从树枝上长出新根须) 谐音助记mangrove谐音：曼谷；曼谷有”红树”。 n.红树（一种热带树木，生于水中或水边，并从树枝上长 出新根须)It is the world’s largest tidal mangrove forest.它是世界上最大的红树林沼泽地。 02 snag [snæɡ] n. (隐伏的)障碍；困难；残桩；划破处；抽丝处；v. 划破；碰到（暗礁或枯树上）；清除（暗礁等）；迅速抓到 谐音助记snag谐音：是那个是那个“障碍”阻碍了我。 n. (隐伏的)障碍I ran into a snag at work, I won’t be able to come home on time.我在工作中遇到了困难，我不能按时回家了。 03 exertion [ɪɡˈzɜːʃn] n. 用力；运用 词根助记exert施加+ion表名词→施加力量→exertion用力 n. 用力The man is breathless from the exertion of pulling the bike uphill那人努力地把自行车往山上拉，累得气喘吁吁。 04 importation [/ˌɪmpɔːˈteɪʃn/] n. 进口 词根助记import进口+ ation表名词→importation进口 n.进口Importation means you buy products from other countries.进口指的是你从其他国家购买产品。 05 malnutrition [mɑːtʃ $ mɑːrtʃ] n. 营养不良 词根助记mal坏+nutrition营养→营养不好→malnutrition营养不良 n.营养不良She suffers from malnutrition as a result of excessive dieting.她因为过度节食导致营养不良。 06 pertinence [ˌpɜː.tɪˈneɪ.ʃəs $ ˌpɝː.tənˈeɪ-] n. 相关性；有关性；针对性 词根助记per完全的+ tin抓住，握住+ence表名词→完全抓住某一事物→pertinence相关性 n. 相关性Map’s pertinence aids students’ understanding.地图的相关性有助于学生理解。 07 destine [ˌdestɪˈneɪʃn] v. 注定；予预定 词根助记de加强+ st站+ ine构词需要→一直站着→ destine注定 v. 注定They are destined to be together forever.他们两人注定一辈子在一起。 08 pompous [ˈpɒm.pəs $ ˈpɑːm-] adj. 傲慢的，浮华的 词根助记pomp炫耀+ ous表形容词→爱炫耀的→pompous傲慢的，浮华的 adj. 傲慢的，浮华的He was rather pompous with a high opinion of his own capabilities.他相当自大，自视甚高。 09 errand [ˈerənd] n. 差事；差使；使命 词根助记err漫游+ and名词后缀→到处漫游→errand差事；差使；使命 n. 差事In many companies, interns run boring errands for their bosses.在许多公司，实习生经常为他们的老板办一些无聊的差事。 10 finite [ˈfaɪnaɪt] adj. 有限的；限定的;【数】有限 词根助记fin结束，范围+ite表形容词→有范围的→ finite有限的，限定的 adj. 有限的The set is finite in size, since it only has four numbers.这个集是有限的，因为它只有四个数字。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-089
content: 01 beetle [ˈbiːtl] n.甲虫；v.快速移动 谐音助记beetle谐音：bee头（蜜蜂头）“甲虫”像蜜蜂的头。 n. 甲虫The boy is looking at the beetle specimens on the wall.这个小男孩正在看墙上的甲虫标本。 … a beetle native to Brazil … popularly called ‘African Payal’ in Kerala.-一种原产于巴西的甲虫….在喀拉拉邦，人们常称其为”非洲巴亚尔”来源：剑8 Test4 阅读 02 mangrove [mɑːtʃ $ mɑːrtʃ] n. 红树（一种热带树木，生于水中或水边，并从树枝上长出新根须) 谐音助记mangrove谐音：曼谷；曼谷有”红树”。 n. 红树（一种热带树木，生于水中或水边，并从树枝上长 出新根须)It is the world’s largest tidal mangrove forest.它是世界上最大的红树林沼泽地。 03 financier [fɪˈnænt.si.ər $ -ɚ] n. 金融家；理财家 词根助记finance财政+ er表人→financier金融家 n. 金融家This man is a successful financier.这个男人是一个成功的金融家。 04 ply [plaɪ] v. 定期往返；辛勤地做，不断做；不断供应；使胶合；（娴熟地）使用；n.一层；一股；厚度；褶 词根助记ply=fold，表重叠，重复→重复做，定期往返 → ply定期往返 v. 定期往返The ships ply across the strait every day.轮船每天往返于海峡两岸。 05 alienation [/ˌeɪliəˈneɪʃn/] n. 疏远；离间；让渡；[哲]异化 词根助记alien陌生的+ ation名词后缀→ alienation疏远 n. 疏远The little zebra among the horses faces alienation for its different stripes.这匹小斑马因为与众不同的条纹而被小马们疏远了。 Iconoclasts face alienation and failure, but can also be a major asset to any organization.反对崇拜偶像的人面临疏远和失败，但也可以成为任何组织的重要资产。来源：剑9 Test2 阅读 06 v. 梳 (头发)；n. 梳子；梳理；abbr.战斗 (=combat) 联想助记快来（come）帮妈妈用“梳子”（comb）“梳理”(comb）头发。 v. 梳 (头发)The mother is combing her daughter’s hair.妈妈正在帮她的女儿梳头发。 .., showing activities from fighting and dancing to everyday acts such as women combing their hair or churning butter.显示从打斗和跳舞到日常行为的活动，例如女性梳理头发或搅拌黄油。来源：剑10 Test1 阅读 n. 梳子… as well as antlers to make useful things like combs.…以及制作梳子等有用物品的鹿角。来源：剑16 Test3 阅读 07 ammonia [əˈməʊniə] n. 氨，氨水;【化】氨气 词根助记ammon氨+ ia →ammonia氨，氨水 n. 氨，氨水He almost fainted because of the smell of ammonia.他几乎要被氨水的味道熏晕了。 08 reverence [ˈrev.ər.ənd $ -rənd $ -ɚ.ənd] n. 崇敬，尊严，敬礼；v. 敬畏，尊敬 词根助记revere尊敬+ ence表名词→reverence崇敬，尊严 n. 崇敬，尊严，敬礼They removed their hats as a sign of reverence at the funeral.在葬礼上，他们脱下帽子表示尊敬。 09 eradicate [ɪˈrædɪkeɪt] v. 消灭；根除 词根助记e除去+radic根+ ate动词后缀→连根除掉→eradicate消灭 v. 消灭I have to eradicate the bugs from my apartment.我必须消灭公寓里的这些虫子。 New methods of food production could eradicate famine.新的粮食生产方法可以消除饥荒。来源：剑10 Test4 听力 10 navigable [niːˈæn.dəˌtɑːl $ -dɚ-] adj.（江河、海洋）可航行的，可通航的;（船）适航的 象形助记 adj.（江河、海洋）可航行的，可通航的The river is wide enough to be a navigable route for ships.这条河很宽，足以成为船只的通航路线。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-088
content: 01 blunder [ˈblʌn.dər $ -dɚ] n. 愚蠢之举；大错；v.犯大错；失策；绊倒 联想助记blunt钝的，人钝了就容易犯”愚蠢的错误”(blunder)。 n. 愚蠢之举He made a blunder, forgetting to bring his passport.他犯了个愚蠢的错误，那就是忘记带护照。 02 avalanche [ˈæv.əl.ɑːnʃ $ -æntʃ] n. 大量拥至；雪崩；vi. 崩塌 象形助记 n. 大量拥至We received an avalanche of documents.我们收到了大量的文件。 Bernstein predicts’an avalanche of interest and support if all goes well.伯恩斯坦预测，如果一切顺利，将会获得大量的兴趣和支持。来源：剑8 Test3 阅读 03 jeer [dʒɪə(r)] v. 嘲笑，戏弄；n.嘲笑，戏弄，挪榆的言语 v. 嘲笑，戏弄Why are you jeering at me? Stop laughing!你为什么嘲笑我？别笑了！ 04 oscillation [ˌɒsɪˈleɪʃn] n. 摆动；振动；动摇；仿徨；振幅；单一的振动循环；【物】振动 词根助记oscillate震动+tion名词后缀→oscillation震动 n. 摆动A force causes the oscillation of the ball.一股力使小球发生摆动。 05 ingenuous [ɪnˈdʒenjuəs] adj. 天真的；单纯的；率直的；坦白的 词根助记in内+gen出生,产生+uous…的→产生自内心→ingenuous天真的 adj. 天真的Her ingenuous smile makes you feel at ease.她天真的笑容让人感到很自在。 06 antecedent [ˌæn.tiˈsiː.dənt $ -t̬ə-] n. 祖先，前情；先例；adj. 先行的，先驱的;【计】前提的 词根助记ante在…前面+ ced走+ ent →走在前面的 →antecedent先行的 n. 祖先，前情It is believed that apes are the antecedents of humans.人们认为猿人是我们的祖先。 07 temporal [ˈtem.pər.əl $ -pɚ.əl] adj. 时间的；太阳穴的；颞的；现世的，世俗的 词根助记tempor时间+al形容词后缀→现世的；暂时的 adj. 时间的He has a very strict temporal order to his daily schedule.他每天的安排都有很严格的时间顺序。 Novels and poems are read in a prescribed temporal sequence.小说和诗歌是按规定的时间顺序阅读的。来源：剑10 Test2 阅读 adj.太阳穴的；颞的Results showed the left temporal lobe of the brain..结果显示大脑左侧颞叶.来源：剑15 Test4 阅读 08 flesh [fleʃ] n. 果肉；肉，肉体 象形助记 n. 果肉She peeled the orange and ate the flesh.她剥开橙子，吃了里面的果肉。 The coconut water gradually solidifies to form the white, edible flesh.椰子汁逐渐凝固，形成白色的可食用的果肉。来源：剑13 Test3 阅读 n.肉，肉体Seeing a living creature in the flesh.看到活生生的生物。来源：剑14 Test4 阅读 09 repent [rɪˈpent] v. 后悔；悔改;(对某事或行为感到）悔恨；adj.【植】匍匐生根的；【动】爬行的 象形助记 v. 后悔The fox repents for his past bullying, hoping they will forgive him.狐狸后悔过去的欺凌行为，希望他们能原谅他。 10 arable [ˈær.ə.bl̩ $ ˈer-] n. 耕地；adj 可耕的，适合种植的 象形助记 n. 耕地They are working in an area of arable land.他们正在耕地里干活。 This is equivalent to… for every hectare of arable land and permanent pasture.对每公顷耕地和永久牧场来说，这相当于..来源：剑7 Test2 阅读
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-087
content: 01 shrug [ˌsaɪ.ə.miːzˈtwɪnz] v. 耸肩；以耸肩表示 (厌恶、轻蔑、怀疑等)；n. 耸肩 象形助记 v. 耸肩He shrugged in response to his mother’s nagging.他耸耸肩，作为对母亲的崂叨的回应。 02 gracious [ˈɡreɪ.ʃəs] adj. 和善的；亲切的；优美的；奢华的 词根助记grac=grat感激，高兴+ious..表形容词→让人高兴的→ gracious和善的；优美的；奢华的 adj. 和善的The gracious queen hugged the boy in the crowd.这位和善的皇后拥抱了人群中的这个男孩。 03 volley [ˈvɒl.i $ ˈvɑː.li] n. 齐射；齐发；v.齐射；进发；[体]截击 联想助记volleyball排球，一排”一齐发射”（volley) n. 齐射The tennis player had a good volley before scoring.这名网球选手在得分前完成了一个很好的截击。 04 proportional [prəˈpɔː.ʃən.əl $ -ˈpɔːr-] adj. 成比例的，相称的;【数】成比例的；n.【数】比例项，比例量 词根助记pro很多+ port部分 + ion表状态 + al属于…的 →proportional成比例的；相称的 adj. 成比例的，相称的I’m eating a bigger burger because I’m bigger! It’s proportional to my weight!我吃大点儿的汉堡是因为我（体型）更大！这和我的体重是成比例的！ … the pace at which they change is directly proportional to temperature,…它们变化的速度与温度成正比,来源：剑16 Test3 阅读 05 syndrome [ˈsɪn.drəʊm $ -droʊm] n.【医】综合症；典型表现 词根助记syn一起+ drome前行→一起来的病→ syndrome 【医】综合征 n.【医】综合症Many people suffer from post-holiday syndrome after a long vacation.很多人在长假后患上了“节后综合症“。 06 din [dɪn] n. 喧闹声，嘈杂声；v. 喧闹，碟噗不休地说 象形助记 n. 喧闹声，嘈杂声She found it difficult to study with the constant din of her family downstairs.家人在楼下发出持续的喧闹声使她很难学习下去。 07 dissertation [ˌdɪs.əˈteɪ.ʃən $ -ɚ-] n.（博士学位）论文；学术演讲；专题 词根助记dis分开+ sert=series一系列的+ ation 名词后缀→将一系列的内容分开→dissertation论文 n.（博士学位）论文He tried to get some ideas for his dissertation from the old studies.他试图从一些旧的研究中为自己的论文找到灵感。 He is thinking of choosing this topic for his dissertation.他考虑用这个作为他论文的主题。来源：剑13 Test1 听力 08 purse [pɜːs $ pɝːs] n. 钱包（尤指女用的），小钱袋，手袋；v.使皱起，起 联想助记(purchase）购买需要要（purse）“钱包”。 n.钱包（尤指女用的），小钱袋，手袋This purse holds some coins.这个钱包装了一些硬币。 In Britain, a ‘Behaviour Insights Team’ has been established to study how people can be encouraged, at minimum cost to the public purse, to live in socially desirable ways.在英国，政府成立了一个”行为洞察小组“，研究如何在公共财政花费最少的情况下，鼓励人们以社会理想的方式生活。来源：剑13 Test4 阅读 09 miscarry [ˌmɪsˈkæri] v. 未运到(目的地）；流产；失败； (信件)误投 词根助记mis坏的，错的，不好的+carry运载→miscarry未运到 (目的地) v. 未运到 (目的地)The parcel must have been miscarried for she never received it.邮包一定投递错了，因为她一直没有收到。 10 skirmish [ˈskɜː.mɪʃ $ ˈskɝː-] n. 小战役，小争吵；v.卷入战役（争论），搜索 象形助记 n. 小战役，小争吵The first skirmish was between the advance guards of the two armies.第一场小战役发生在两军前锋部队之间。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-086
content: 01 postmortem [ˌpəʊstˈmɒdɪfaɪə(r)] n. 验尸，尸体解剖；adj.事后的，死后的，事后检查或详论的 n. 验尸，尸体解剖Postmortem reports help solve many mysteries in crime.验尸报告帮助解决了许多犯罪之谜。 02 chronic [ˈkrɒn.ɪk $ ˈkrɑː.nɪk] adj.（问题）长期的、顽固的;(疾病）慢性的；积习难改的 adj.（问题）长期的、顽固的Insomnia is a chronic problem that must be fixed.失眠是一个必须解决的顽固问题。 Chronic noise may produce serious, lasting effects.长期的噪音可能会产生严重的、持久的影响。来源：剑7 Test4 阅读 03 defray [dɪˈfreɪ] v. 支付；支出；【法】支付，承担 (费用) v. 支付These money should help to defray your expenses.这些钱应该可以帮你支付开支。 04 vouch [vaʊtʃ] v. 担保；证明；保证；n.被担保者 象形助记 v. 担保I can vouch for the quality of this product: I guarantee your satisfaction!我能担保这个产品的品质：我保证你会满意！ 05 civic [ˌsiː.dʒeɪˈdiː] adj. 市民的；城市的 词根助记civ公民+ic形容词后缀→civic市民的；城市的 adj. 市民的Civic Center Plaza is the cultural and political center of San Francisco.市中心广场是旧金山市的文化政治中心。 06 frugal [ˈfruː.ɡəl] adj. 节俭的，俭朴的；廉价的，花钱少的 词根助记frug（fruit）果实、享受+al形容词后缀→为了享受，必须精打细算，勤俭节约→frugal节俭的，俭朴的 adj. 节俭的，俭朴的He’s such a frugal person who always mends his old clothes.他生活很节俭，总是缝补破了的衣服。 07 patriotism [ˈpæt.ri.ə.tɪ.zəm $ ˈpeɪ.tri- $ ˈpeɪ.tri-] n. 爱国主义，爱国心，爱国精神 词根助记patri祖，祖国+ot+ ism主义→patriotism爱国主义，爱国心，爱国精神 n. 爱国主义，爱国心，爱国精神He has a strong sense of patriotism.他有很强的爱国主义意识。 08 pry [praɪ] v. 刺探，打听，撬开；n. 窥探；杠杆；爱打探的人 象形助记 v. 刺探，打听，撬开I’ll have to pry the nails out with thistool.我要用这个工具把钉子撬出来。 09 splint [splɪnt] n. 夹板，薄木片，托板 联想助记“夹板”(splint）裂开（split) n. 夹板，薄木片，托板He is wearing a splint on his broken leg.他的断腿上戴着夹板。 10 carton [ˈkɑːtn] n.（尤指装食品和液体的）硬纸盒，纸板箱，塑料箱 象形助记 n.（尤指装食品和液体的)硬纸盒，纸板箱，塑料箱Drinking a carton of milk per day is good for your health!每天一盒牛奶，有助于身体健康！
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-085
