..广告图像和叮当声、政治口号和军乐..来源：剑7 Test3 阅读 04 competent [ˈkɒm.pɪ.tənt $ ˈkɑːm.pə.t̬ənt] adj 有能力的；称职的；能胜任的；合格的 象形助记 She’s a competent worker and is good at her job.她是一个有能力的员工，并且擅长她的工作。 ..improving pupils’ learning to learn techniques should be a major outcome of the school experience, especially for the highly competent...提高学生的学习技巧应该是学校经验的主要成果，特别是对高能力的学生。来源：剑10 Test2 阅读 ..if Watson generated a recommendation that contradicted the experts’ opinion, doctors would typically conclude that Watson wasn’t competent.如果沃森提出的建议与专家的意见相矛盾，医生通常会得出结论，认为沃森不称职。来源：剑16 Test4 阅读 05 peril [ˈper.əl] n.危险；vt.置…于危险中；危及 谐音助记peril谐音：派肉给狗派肉有”危险”。 The man faced the peril of falling off the cliff.这个男人面临着掉下悬崖的危险。 We mess with them at our peril如果惹上他们，我们将处于危险。来源：剑16 Test2 阅读 06 gullible [ˈɡʌl.ə.bl̩] adj.易受骗的；轻信的 词根助记gull易受骗之人+ible表形容词→ gulible易受骗的 This product was aimed to be sold to gullible old people.这款产品专门卖给容易上当受骗的老年人。 07 novice [ˈnɒvɪs] n.生手，新手 词根助记nov新+ice表名词→novice新手 The yoga instructor is helping the novice into position.瑜伽课老师正在帮助初学者摆好姿势。 … a novice stands next to experts and learns by observation.…一名新手站在专家旁边，观摩学习。来源：剑16 Test1 阅读 08 discrimination [dɪˌskrɪm.ɪˈneɪ.ʃən] n.歧视；偏见；区别对待；【财】歧视 词根助记dis分开，分离+crimin分辨+ation名词后缀→把东西分开来分辨→discrimination区别，引申为”歧视” This little duck suffers discrimination because it looks different from others.这只小鸭子因为长相不同于其他的鸭子而受到歧视。 09 ribbon [ˈrɪb.ən] n.带状物；缎带，丝带 联想助记肋骨（rib）一样的形状的”条状物”（ribbon）。 The road looks like a ribbon of moonlight.这条路在月光下如同一条缎带。 Inspection technology allows more than 100 million measurements a second to be made across the ribbon.,…检测技术允许每秒在条带上进行超过1亿次测量，来源：剑8 Test2 阅读 10 invariably [ɪnˈveəriəbli] adv.总是；不变地，永恒地 词根助记in不+variably易变地→invariably总是 It’s common sense that the moon orbits the earth invariably.月亮总是绕着地球转，这是常识。 Studies show that we invariably take more gambles when threatened with a loss than when offered a reward.研究表明，当受到损失带来的威胁时，我们总是比得到奖励时更加冒险。来源：剑10 Test1 阅读
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-013
content: 01 genetic [dʒəˈnet.ɪk $ -ˈnet̬-] adj. 基因的；遗传的；遗传学的；起源的 词根助记gen出生，产生+etic与….相关的→与出生相关的→ genetic基因的，遗传学的 Genetic engineering can be done with plants, animals, or microorganisms.基因工程可以作用于植物、动物或微生物。 In biological systems, organisms may display new characteristics that result from random genetic mutations.在生物系统中，生物体可能由于随机的基因突变而表现出新的特征。来源：剑17 Test2 阅读 In recent years, new clues have come from research into genetics, including the distribution of genetic markers in modern Native Americans.近年来，遗传学研究提供了新的线索，包括现代美洲原住民遗传标记的分布。来源：剑7 Test3 阅读 But there is no doubt that the new genetic and dental evidence provides strong backing for Greenberg’s view.但毫无疑问，新的基因和牙科证据为格林伯格的观点提供了强有力的支持。来源：剑7 Test3 阅读 02 brim [brɪm] n.边缘；边；v.充满，注满；注满 象形助记 She touched the brim of her hat.她摸了摸帽檐。 03 acclaim [əˈkleɪm] n.欢呼，赞扬，称赞；vt.欢呼，喝彩；推选 词根助记ac去+claim呼喊→ acclaim喝彩，赞扬 She was highly acclaimed for her wonderful performance.她因自己出色的成绩受到了高度称赞。 Moore was the first modern English sculptor to achieve international critical acclaim and …摩尔是第一位获得国际赞誉的现代英国雕塑家…..来源：剑15 Test3 阅读 04 concur [kənˈkɜːr $ -ˈkɝː] v.同意；一致；同意，赞成 She decided to concur with my suggestion.她同意我的建议。 Sceptics and advocates alike do concur on one issue, ..怀疑论者和支持者对一个问题持有相同意见，来源：剑8 Test1 阅读 05 promote [-prɒŋd $ -prɑːŋd] v.促进；宣传；提升，升级；升职；促动；促销；推动；发起，创办 词根助记pro向前，在前+ mot动+e→向前动→ promote促进 Vaccine can promote the body’s ability against viruses.疫苗可以增强身体抵御病毒的能力。 Tourism has a social impact because it promotes recreation.旅游业之所以具有社会影响力，是因为它促进了娱乐行业发展。来源：剑10 Test3 阅读 … museums continue to promote the special status of original work.…但博物馆仍在继续宣传原作的特殊地位。来源：剑10 Test2 阅读 … by providing objects or experiences that promote aspects of a curriculum..通过提供能提升课程质量方面的学习物品或各种经验来丰富孩子的学习环境。来源：剑14 Test3 阅读 06 nostalgia [nɒˈstældʒə] n.怀旧之情，思乡病 词根助记nost家+alg痛+ia病→想家的痛苦→nostalgia怀旧之情，思乡病 That letter triggers his nostalgia for his hometown.这封信激起了他的乡愁。 No wonder that people who stroll around exhibitions are filled with nostalgia…难怪逛展览的人充满了怀旧之情，来源：剑9 Test4 阅读 07 souvenir [ˈsəʊ.vi.ət $ ˈsoʊ-] n.纪念品；vt.把..留作纪念 象形助记 I bought a handmade bell as a souvenir for my friend.我给朋友买了一个手工铃铛作为纪念品。 People wanted to buy photographs as souvenirs of a trip or as gifts …人们想买照片作为旅行的纪念品或礼物..来源：剑14 Test2 阅读 08 prescribe [prɪˈskraɪb] vt.命令，指示；给….开药；v.【计〗规定 词根助记pre预先+ scribe写→预先写好命令→prescribe命令，指示 The coach will prescribe our daily exercise routine.教练将制定我们的日常锻炼计划。 This approach is summarised in the statement that it is the task of the grammarian to describe, not prescribe…这种方法总结为：语法学家的任务是描述而不是命令..来源：剑9 Test3 阅读 09 detriment [ˈdet.rɪ.mənt] n.损害，不利，伤害；损害物；【法〗损失 词根助记de坏+tri=trit摩擦+ ment表名词→磨坏了→detriment损害 Staying up very late is a detriment to one’s health.熬夜有害身体健康。 Researcher Joan Goodman (1994) suggested that hybrid forms of work and play are not a detriment to learning …研究人员Joan Goodman（1994）认为，工作和游戏相结合不会不利于学习..来源：剑14 Test3 阅读 10 ostensible [ɒsˈtent.sɪ.bl̩ $ ɑːˈstent-] adj.表面上的，伪装的 词根助记os向前+tens伸出+ible表形容词→伸出来了→ostensible表面上的，伪装的 The ostensible reason for the wolf’s arrival is to wish the chick a happy birthday.狼声称他来访的理由是为给小鸡庆祝生日。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-012
content: 01 therapy [ˈθerəpi] n.治疗，理疗；疗法 词根助记therap治疗+y表名词→ therapy治疗，理疗 The man is trying a kind of Chinese therapy.这个男人正在尝试一种中医理疗。 02 advance [ədˈvɑːns] n.进步，进展；预先；增长；预付款；v.前进；促进，推动；发展；提出；提升；提前；预付；（价格）上涨；adj.先遣的；先头部队的；预先的，事先的 词根助记ad离开+ vance前面的→离开前面的东西→advance进步，发展 Mobile communications has advanced considerably.移动通信已经取得了显著进步。 The advances are not as significant as the public believes them to be.这些进步并不像公众认为的那么重要。来源：剑13 Test1 阅读 You must book it in advance.你必须提前预定。来源：剑14 Test4 听力 There are many reasons why technology is advancing so fast.技术进步如此之快有很多原因。来源：剑15 Test1 阅读 03 bother [ˈbɒð.ər $ ˈbɑː.ðɚ] v.费心，费时；打扰，因….操心；麻烦；(使)担心,(使)生气， (使)苦恼；n.麻烦；不便；烦恼，焦急 象形助记 He didn’t even bother to prepare a gift for our anniversary.他甚至没花时间为我们的周年纪念日准备礼物。 The wheels of language run so smoothly that one rarely bothers to stop and think …语言的车轮运转得如此顺畅，以至于人们很少停下来思考…..来源：剑11 Test4 阅读 04 downward [ˈdaʊnwəd] adv.向下；adj 向下的，下降的 词根助记down向下 + ward向…→ downward向下地 I fell downward through the air, hoping my parachute would open.我从空中降落，期望着我的降落伞会打开。 ..upward by night to seek food, downward by day to escape predators..…夜间向上寻找食物，白天向下躲避捕食者.来源：剑11 Test3 阅读 05 apiece [əˈpiːs] adv.每人；每个；各自地 词根助记a一个+piece块，张→apiece每人 We all got 5 dollars apiece.我们每个人都得到了5美元。 06 holocaust [ˈhɒləkɔːst] n.大屠杀，浩劫 词根助记holo全部+caust烧→全部烧光→holocaust大屠杀 Millions and millions of innocent people were killed in the holocaust.数以百万计的无辜人群在那场浩劫中被屠杀。 07 muster [ˈmʌstə(r)] vi.集合；聚集；vt.集合；召集；n.集合人员；集合 象形助记 The soldiers mustered for a new mission.士兵们为了新的任务而集合。 08 allegiance [əˈliːdʒəns] n.忠诚，拥护 词根助记al向+leg臣子+i+ance名词后缀→臣子向君王的忠诚→allegiance忠诚，拥护 He swore his allegiance to the king.他宣誓效忠于国王。 09 twist [twɪst] (形势或事态的）意外转折；搓，扭，拧；意外进展；弯曲处；盘旋；v.拧，捻，搓；扭；歪曲；扭转，转动 (身体部位) 联想助记双胞胎（twins）的出现是这件事的”意外转折”（twist）。 Life is constantly full of twists and turns.生活总是充满曲折。 But twin studies took a surprising twist in the 1980s.但在20世纪80年代，双胞胎研究出现了令人惊讶的转折。来源：剑11 Test4 阅读 10 snack [snæk] n.零食，小吃，快餐；点心；v.（在正餐之间）吃零食；吃零嘴 联想助记懒散slack的边吃零食snack边工作 I’ve prepared a few snacks for you to enjoy before dinner.我准备了一些零食供你在晚餐前享用。 Children may bring healthy snacks with them.孩子们可以随身携带健康的零食。来源：剑17 Test3 听力 the sandwich we have for lunch, and the biscuits we snack on during the day.我们午餐吃的三明治，以及我们白天吃的零食饼干。来源：剑17 Test3 阅读
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-011
content: 01 hinge [hɪndʒ] n.枢纽，关键；铰链；合叶；v.给…安上铰链 谐音助记hinge谐音：hin（横）+ge（折）→枢纽有横着折叠的 The hinge of the situation is what he decides to do next.情况的转折点取决于他接下来决定做什么。 In this hinge moment between print and digital cultures, society needs to …在这个印刷和数字文化的关键时刻，社会需要…来源：剑16 Test4 阅读 02 vacancy [ˈveɪ.kənt.si] (职位）空缺；空，空白，空房；空虚；【财】空缺 词根助记vacan(t)空缺的+ cy名词后缀→vacancy (职位)空缺 There’s a job vacancy–let me apply!这儿有个职位空缺，我要申请！ You will get access to vacancies which are not advertised.您将有机会获得未发布广告的空缺职位。来源：剑15 Test1 听力 03 mansion [mɑːtʃ $ mɑːrtʃ] n.官邸，巨宅，公馆 词根助记mans=manse住宅＋ ion物→ mansion官邸，巨宅，公馆 Look at how huge that mansion is!你看这座宅邸多宏伟！ The family often stayed at Press Castle, the large mansion on the northern edge of the property, ..一家人经常住在该物业北部边缘的大宅邸普雷斯城堡····.来源：剑14 Test2 阅读 04 decent [ˈdiː.sənt] adj 体面的，得体的；正派的；像样的；合宜的；相当不错的；穿好了衣服的 词根助记dec合适的+ ent形容词后缀→ decent体面的 The gentleman in the decent suit displayed great charm.这位绅士衣着得体，魅力十足。 05 dictate [dɪkˈteɪt $ ˈ–] v.决定，支配；规定；命令；口授；听写（读作/drk’tert/或/dik,tert/)；n.命令；指令(读作/“dik,tert/) 词根助记dict说话，断言+ ate动词后缀→通过说话命令别人→dictate决定，支配 It is you who dictate your future.是你决定你的未来。 … phytochromes control genetic switches in response to temperature as well as light to dictate plantdevelopment.……光敏色素通过控制基因开关来应对温度和光线，从而决定植物的发育。来源：剑16 Test3 阅读 06 idyll [ˈɪdɪl] n.田园诗，牧歌 象形助记 Tao Yuanming’s famous idylls were inspired by his life in the fields.陶渊明田园诗的创作灵感源自他的田园生活。 07 tacit [ˈtæs.ɪt] adj.心照不宣的，静默的 词根助记tac安静+it→tacit静默的，心照不宣的 It is a tacit agreement that cell phones should be turned off during meeting.开会时手机应该保持静音是大家心照不宣的共识。 08 utter [ˈʌt.ər $ ˈʌ.t̬ɚ] vt.说；讲；发出；发射；adj.完全的；彻底的；无条件的；十足的 联想助记utter谐音：爱他；爱他就要“说”出来 Looking at these documents, he uttered a sigh.看着这些文件，他叹了口气。 09 reluctant [rɪˈlʌk.tənt] adj. 不情愿的；勉强的 词根助记re相反，相对+luct努力，挣扎+ ant表形容词→向反方向挣扎→reluctant不情愿的 The dog was reluctant to take a bath.狗狗不愿意去洗澡。 To do that, we need to understand why people are so reluctant to trust Al in the first place.要做到这一点，我们首先需要理解为什么人们如此不愿意信任人工智能。来源：剑16 Test4 阅读 10 prohibit [prəˈhɪb.ɪt] v.禁止；阻止 词根助记pro向前，提前+hibit拿住，握住→在前面拿住→prohibit阻止，禁止 The law prohibits spitting in public.该法令禁止在公共场合随地吐痰。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-010
content: 01 intensive [ɪnˈtensɪv] adj.集约的；密集的；加强的；强调的；n.加强器；【语】强义词，强调成份 词根助记intense高度集中的+ive形容词后缀→（农业）高度集中的→intensive集约的 Intensive poultry farms have a bad name.集约化家禽养殖场的名声不好。 The revolution involved intensive commercial farming …这场革命包括集约化的商业耕作….来源：剑8 Test2 阅读 However, the process took a long time and was labour-intensive.然而，这一过程需要很长时间，而且是劳动密集型的。来源：剑8 Test2 阅读 What are the advantages and disadvantages of intensive training for young sportspeople?对年轻运动员来说，强化训练有什么好处和坏处？来源：剑7 Test3 口语 02 infest [ɪnˈfest] v.骚扰，寄生于，大批出没 词根助记in不，非+fest击，打，抓住→抓不住的，控制不住的→infest骚扰，寄生于，大批出没 The warehouse is infested with rats.仓库里鼠满为患。 About 30,000 hectares of rice fields in Kerala are infested by this weed.喀拉拉邦约有3万公顷的稻田受到这种杂草的侵扰。来源：剑8 Test4 阅读 03 wail [weɪl] vi.恸哭；悲叹；n.恸哭；哀诉；vt.哀悼 象形助记 The baby began to wail when he woke up and his mom wasn’t there.这个宝宝醒来发现妈妈不在身边，开始放声大哭。 04 fleet [ˈflem.ɪʃ] n.舰队，船队；车队；机群；adj. 迅速的 联想助记遇到敌方“舰队“（fleet）就逃跑（flee）。 The big fleet of ships always stay together.这支舰队的舰船总是一起行动。 … the Dutch commercial fleet swiftly grew into one of the largest in the world...-荷兰商业舰队迅速发展成为世界最强之一。来源：剑15 Test1 阅读 … in the next decade the EU will see a further substantial increase in its fleet.在接下来的十年中，欧盟将会看到其舰队进一步大幅增加。来源：剑10 Test1 阅读 05 enforce [ɪnˈfɔːs] v.执行；实施；强制；使服从 (法律) 词根助记en进入+force强大，力量→力量强行进入→enforce强制；实施，执行 The new parking restrictions will be strictly enforced.新的停车规定将被严格执行。 … they also needed to be enforced...它们也需要被执行。来源：剑15 Test4 阅读 I’d like to see governments seizing the opportunity to improve policy to enforce good job security.我希望看到政府抓住机会改善政策，以实施良好的工作保障来源：剑16 Test1 阅读 06 assert [əˈsɜːt] v.维护；断言；肯定地说；坚持 词根助记as加强+sert加入，插入→强行插入观点维护己方→assert维护 He got a lawyer to help him assert his rights.他找了一位律师帮自己维权。 … rival chieftains lacked other ways of asserting their dominance.…竞争的酋长缺乏其他维护自己统治地位的方式。来源：剑11 Test2 阅读 07 adept [əˈdept] adj 熟练的；巧妙的(读作/a’dept/)；n.专家，能手(读作/aedept/) 象形助记 The smart girl was an adept student.这个聪明的女生是一个学习能手。 Yet others go into mathematical procedures, but assume that the reader is adept in using algebra.还有一些人深入研究数学程序，但假设读者擅长使用代数。来源：剑11Test3阅读 08 perplex [pəˈpleks $ pɚ-] v. 使困惑 词根助记per贯穿，自始自终+plex重叠→始终重叠→perplex使困惑 The problem perplexes the woman； she is very confused.这个问题很费解，她好困惑。 One question that has perplexed visitors, historians and archaeologists alike ever since Bingham, is …自宾汉姆以来，有一个问题一直困扰着游客、历史学家和考古学家，那就是.来源：剑12 Test6 阅读 09 pebble [ˈpeb.l̩] n.小圆石，小鹅卵石；vt.用卵石铺；用石子扔；使纹理粗糙 象形助记 The pebbles on the beach are rocks worn smoothly by the water.沙滩上的小鹅卵石是被水磨光滑的岩石。 10 universally [ˌjuːnɪˈvɜːsəli] adv.普遍地；到处 词根助记universal 普遍的+ly 副词后缀→ universally 普遍地 It is universally accepted that the earth moves around the sun.大家普遍认为地球绕着太阳转。 Together, the results fuelled the view that oxytocin universally enhanced the positive aspects of our social nature.总的来说，这些结果支持了这样一种观点，即催产素普遍增强了我们社会积极的方面。来源：剑13 Test2 阅读
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-009
content: 01 contempt [kənˈtempt] n.鄙视，轻视 This gesture symbolizes contempt.这个手势象征着鄙视。 02 adjustment [əˈdʒʌstmənt] (行为、思想的）调整，适应；调节 词根助记adjust调整+ment名词后缀→adjustment调整，适应 This animal made an adjustment in its skin color to protect itself.这种动物为了保护自己，对其皮肤颜色进行了调整。 But of course, this is not entirely the case； adjustments have to be made in methods of learning and teaching ..但当然，情况并非完全如此；必须调整学习和教学方法.来源：剑10 Test2 阅读 03 flock [flɒk $ flɑːk] n.（鸟或羊的）群；一群人；(对牧师而言的）教徒；vi.聚集，成群而行 词根助记f(ly)飞+(b)lock一批→飞来一批鸟→flock聚集，成群而行；（鸟或羊的）群 A flock of sheep were grazing on the grassland.一群羊在草地上吃草。 Flying in vast numbers across North America, with potentially many millions within a single flock …它们成群结队飞越北美，一大群中可能有数百万只.来源：剑15 test2 阅读 Tourists flock to wells in far-flung corners of north-western India ..游客们涌向印度西北部偏远角落的水井.来源：剑10 Test1 阅读 04 swirl [swɜːl $ swɝːl] v.打旋；大口喝酒；盘绕；眩晕；n.涡状形；漩涡；打旋 象形助记 She is swirling the wine in the glass.她正让杯子里的葡萄酒旋转。 05 deficit [ˈdef.ɪ.sɪt] n.缺少，缺陷；亏损；赤字；不足额 词根助记de不+fic做+it名词后缀，表抽象名词→做得不够 → deficit缺少，缺陷 The boy has a deficit in paying attention.这个男孩在集中注意力方面有缺陷。 Children with auditory function deficit are potentially failing to …有听觉功能缺陷的儿童可能无法…..来源：剑9 Test2 阅读 06 hull [ˌaɪ.siː.biːˈem] n（果实等的）外壳，船体；v. 剥壳 n.（果实等的）外壳，船体The hull of a ship is often protected against corrosion with a coat of special paint.船舶的船身通常涂一层特殊的漆以抗腐蚀。 They had a wider hull, double planking and a solid interior for added stability.它们有更宽的船体，双层甲板和坚固的内部以增加稳定性。来源：剑16 Test3 阅读 07 deceive [dɪˈsiːv] v. 欺骗，行骗 词根助记de变坏+ceive拿，抓，握→不用好的手段拿→deceive欺骗 He deceived the old man about the contract he was signing.在签合同这件事情上，他欺骗了老人。 08 spectacular [spekˈtæk.jʊ.lər $ -lɚ] adj 壮观的，引人入胜的；惊人的；壮丽的；n.壮观的场面，精彩的表演 词根助记spectac=look看+ular..的→让人忍不住看的→spectacular引l人注目的；壮观的 Waterfalls are among the most spectacular gifts nature bestows on us.瀑布是大自然赐予我们的最壮观的礼物之一。 .., had sent back spectacular images of Jupiter and Saturn……已经发回了木星和土星的壮观图像…来源：剑9 Test3 阅读 For passenger transport, the determining factor is the spectacular growth in car use.对于客运来说，决定因素是汽车使用量的惊人增长。来源：剑10 Test1 阅读 09 attribute [əˈtrɪbjuːt] v.把…归因于，把…归咎于（读作/atrbjut）；认为是…所为 (或说、写、作)；n.属性；特征；标志；象征（读作/aetra,bjut/）；定语；·【财】属性，特质；【计】属性；【数】属性；【计】特性 词根助记at + tribut给予 +e → attribute把….归因于 Success can be attributed to hard work and a bit of luck.成功都可以归因于努力的奋斗和些许的运气。 We can, perhaps, attribute mediocre results to an inadequate placebo effect.我们或许可以将平庸的结果归因于安慰剂效应不足。来源：剑7 Test1 阅读 … that retains most of the attributes and functions of existing products in the category..保留了该类别中现有产品的大部分属性和功能的产品或服务来源：剑13 Test2 阅读 but some historians and scholars attribute a much longer time for his rule..但一些历史学家和学者认为他的统治时间要长得多..来源：剑16 Test1 阅读 10 ordeal [ɔːˈdɪəl $ ɔːr-] n.严峻的考验，苦难的经历，折磨 联想助记面对困难，要么（or）解决（deal），要么忍受”严峻的考验”(ordeal)。 It will be a big ordeal getting to the middle of the maze.走到迷宫中间对我来说一定是个严峻的考验。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-008
content: 01 implicit [ɪmˈplɪsɪt] adj.隐含的；完全的，绝对的；盲目的；成为一部分的；固有的；【计】隐式 These emojis have implicit meanings.这些表情符号具有隐含意义。 I have suggested that there are three major implicit theories of how intelligence relates to society as a whole …关于智力如何与整个社会相关，我提出了三种主要的隐含理论.来源：剑14 Test3 阅读 02 appetite [ˈæpɪtaɪt] n.强烈欲望；需求；食欲；胃口；嗜好 She has a strong appetite for this cake.她对这块蛋糕有强烈的欲望。 … as directors have to make the numbers’ every four months to meet the insatiable appetite of the market for more data..因为董事们必须每四个月公布一次数字，以满足市场想对更多数据一探究竟的强烈欲望。来源：剑12 Test8 阅读 03 desirable [dɪˈzaɪərəbl] adj.理想的，值得拥有的；令人满意的；值得做的；有吸引力的；性感的；令人向往的 A desirable weekend is lying on the sofa, watching TV and eating snacks.一个理想周末是躺在沙发上看电视、吃零食。 Mutations in their genetic structure, which resulted in desirable traits such as larger fruit.它们的基因结构发生了突变，从而产生了理想的性状，比如更大的果实。来源：剑17 Test2 阅读 04 emit [ɪˈmɪt] vt.发射，发出；散发；发表；排放 词根助记e 向外,离开+ mit送,放出→向外发送→散发 The little boy holds a flashlight that emits a ray of light.小男孩儿手持一只手电筒，发射出一束光。 05 exhaust [ɪɡˈzɔːst] vt.耗尽；使筋疲力尽；详尽论述；排空；n.排气装置；废气；排气 词根助记ex用完+haust抽出→抽完→exhaust用尽，耗尽 We have exhausted all the toilet roll.我们已经耗尽了厕纸。 The talents of geniuses are soon exhausted.天才的才能很快就会耗尽。来源：剑8 Test3 阅读 The thylacine was not a fast runner and probably caught its prey by exhausting it during a long pursuit.这只袋狼跑得不快，可能是通过长时间追逐使其筋疲力尽才抓到的。来源：剑17 Test3 阅读 06 faction [ˈfæk.ʃən] n.派别，小集团，小派系；派系斗争，内订；门派 词根助记fact做，制作+ion名词后缀→（一帮人）做→faction小集团 The leaders of two opposing factions had a talk.这两个敌对派系的领导人进行了会谈。 07 enclose [ɪnˈkləʊz] v.围住；圈起；装入信封；附有；随信（或包裹）附上；【化】封闭，包围 词根助记en使+ close关闭→使关闭围起来→enclose包围，围住 The girl enclosed the butterflies in the glass jar.女孩把蝴蝶装到了玻璃罐里。 .. enclosed sections of canal in which the water level could be raised or lowered…水位可以升高或降低的封闭运河部分..来源：剑11 Test1 阅读 08 liability [ˌlaɪəˈbɪləti] n.责任；负担；债务；倾向；可能性；不利因素；惹麻烦的人（或事）；【财】负债；【法】责任 词根助记liabil=liable捆绑，联合，约束+ ity表名词→用..约束某人→liability责任 I hope the truck driver has insurance to pay for his liability for the damage.希望卡车司机买了保险，以支付他在车祸中造成的责任损失。 … the regulatory challenges in understanding how liability and enforcement might change ……在理解责任和执行可能发生的变化方面的监管挑战..来源：剑15 Test1 阅读 Short contends that glass skyscrapers in London and around the world will become a liability …肖特认为，伦敦和世界各地的玻璃摩天大楼将成为一种负担..来源：剑14 Test2 阅读 09 elevate [ˈel.ɪ.veɪt] vt.提高；上升；举起；提拔 词根助记e出+lev提高，举起，变轻+ate动词后缀→举高→elevate升高，提高 He was elevated to a position with higher salary.他被提升到一个更高薪水的职位。 The Wheel could not be constructed to elevate boats over the full 35-metre difference between the two canals.摩天轮的构造无法将船只提高到两个运河之间完整的35米高度…．.来源：剑11 Test1 阅读 10 shot [ˌsaɪ.ə.miːzˈtwɪnz] n.尝试；发射；射击，枪声；击球；（电影中的）镜头；照片；少量烈酒；注射；子弹；v.投球；射击；adj. 用尽的；破旧的；杂色的 联想助记这一次”尝试”（shot）很成功，虽然维持时间很短(short)。 He’d like to have a shot at that question.他想试着回答那个问题。 Why is it that on paper the drive for organisation seems a sure shot for increasing productivity, but ..为什么理论上组织的驱动力似乎是提高生产力的必然选择，但是…来源：剑14 Test2 阅读
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-007
content: 01 undergraduate [ˌʌndəˈɡrædʒuət] n.(本科）学生；adj. 大学本科生的 词根助记under低于，不够+ graduate毕业生→还未毕业→undergraduate（本科）学生 I went to college and became an undergraduate after high school.我高中毕业后成了一名大学生。 However, they would be well-suited for undergraduates learning about the economics of cities.然而，它们非常适合本科生学习城市经济学。来源：剑17 Test3 阅读 02 extravagant [ɪkˈstræv.ə.ɡənt] adj. 奢侈的，无节制的 词根助记extra超过+vag漫游+ ant表形容词→漫游多的→extravagant奢侈的，无节制的 The family lives in an extravagant house.这家人住在奢华的房子里。 03 recession [rɪˈseʃ.ən] n(经济）衰退，不景气；后退，撤回；凹处；【财】；经济衰退；(经济）衰退 词根助记re回，向后+cess行走，前进+ion名词后缀→走回去→recession撤退；(经济）衰退，不景气 During a recession, there’s less money in the economy to spend on goods or investments.在经济衰退期间，用于购买商品或投资的资金减少了。 In contrast to the many companies that responded to the recession by cutting prices,…与许多通过降价应对经济衰退的公司不同，….。来源：剑13 Test2 阅读 04 yield [jiːld] n.产量；收益；产出；vt.产生（收益、效益等）；出产（作物）；获得；vi.屈服；让步；弯曲；让行 谐音助记yield谐音：已有的；已有的”产量”(yield)很多。 We should further improve the yield of the crop.我们应该进一步提高农作物的产量。 Soil erosion decreased their crop yields.水土流失降低了他们的作物产量。来源：剑11 Test2 阅读 … but eventually the usefulness of the process of organisation, and the benefit it yields ……但最终组织过程的用处及其产生的好处来源：剑14 Test2 阅读 05 standstill [ˈstæn.li.naɪf] n.停止，停顿；adj. 停顿的，停滞的，引起停顿的，造成停滞的 词根助记stand站立+stil静止的→站在那里一动不动→standstill停止，停顿 The parade ahead brought all traffic on the road to a standstill.前方游行队伍使所有道路交通陷入停止。 06 concession [kənˈseʃ.ən] n.让步；特许，特许权；承认；【财】让步，妥协 词根助记conces让步+ sion名词后缀→concession 让步，妥协 The mother made a concession and allowed the boy to continue watching TV.妈妈让步了，同意让小男孩再多看一会儿电视。 07 crave [kreɪv] v. 渴望；恳求 联想助记关在洞里（cave），“渴望”（crave）出去。 I’m really craving a glass of refreshing iced tea right now.我现在真的好想喝杯提神的冰红茶哦。 08 nutrition [njuˈtrɪʃn] n.营养；营养学；滋养 词根助记nutrit营养+ion表名词→nutrition营养 Having balanced nutrition is important to maintain a healthy body.营养均衡对于维持身体健康很重要。 Although more and more people attain an advanced age as a result of developments in medical care and better nutrition…虽然由于医疗保健的发展和营养的改善，越来越多的人达到高龄.来源：剑8 Test3 阅读 09 traverse [trəˈvɜːs $ -ˈvɝːs] v. 横越；穿过；反对，阻碍（读作/tra’v3rs/）；【计】遍历；n. 横越 (读作/traevars/) 象形助记 Is it safe to traverse the flimsy rope bridge?横越易坏的索桥安全吗？ While traversing the vast distances across the galaxy…在穿越银河系的遥远距离时..来源：剑9 Test1 阅读 10 offspring [ˈɒfsprɪŋ] n. (动物的)崽；后代；子女；(植物的）幼苗；【生】后代，子孙 词根助记off结束+ spring春宵→春宵一度的结晶→offspring子女后代 The mother lion takes care of her five offspring.母狮照看她的五只幼崽。 .. change the genetic make-up of the pests’ offspring.…改变害虫后代的基因组成。来源：剑8 Test4 阅读
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-006
content: 01 conservative [kənˈsɜː.və.tɪv $ -ˈsɝː.və.t̬ɪv] adj 保守的；保守估计的；保守党的；n.保守者；保守党党员 词根助记conserv保留+a+tive形容词后缀→有保留的→conservative保守的 The man has such a conservative attitude； he even despises the couple holding hands.这个人的态度如此保守，就连情侣牵手他都看不惯。 And according to Professor Pretty, it was a conservative estimate.根据普雷蒂教授的说法，这是一个保守的估计。来源：剑7 Test2 阅读 02 dormant [ˈdɔːmənt] adj睡眠的，休眠的；静止的，隐伏的 Frogs lie dormant underground during winter, covered in fallen leaves.冬天，青蛙在盖有落叶的地下休眠。 03 laborious [ˈleɪ.bər $ -bɚ] adj. 费时费力的，辛苦的；艰苦的 The young girl spent many laborious hours studying for the test.这个女孩花费了大量的时间来为考试做准备。 04 delight [dɪˈlaɪt] n.快乐；高兴事；v.使快乐；享受 词根助记de完全地+light诱惑→完全将其迷惑住→ delight快乐 The boy takes great delight in mountain biking.这个男孩以山地骑行为乐。 … much to the delight of self-proclaimed perfectionists with the need to get everything right...这让那些自称是完美主义者的人很高兴，因为他们需要把所有事情都做对。来源：剑14 Test2 阅读 05 pin [pɪn] v.确切说明；别住，钉住，固定住；n.别针，饰针；（有别针的）徽章 谐音助记pin谐音：拼用”别针”可以把这个东西“固定”起来，然后再”确切说明”它的作用。 The doctor has pinned down the problem in his lung.医生确认了他肺部的问题。 He set out with an apparently simple aim: to pin down the precise meaning of the concept of “information”.他出发的目的显然很简单：确定“信息”这一概念的确切含义。来源：剑9 Test3 阅读 06 sober [ˌsəʊˈkɔːld $ ˌsoʊˈkɑːld] adj.未饮醉的，清醒的；有节制的；严肃的；vi. 变得冷静；v.使清醒；使冷静 联想助记他不哭（sob）了，“变得冷静”（sober）了。 As the driver tonight, I cannot drink alcohol in order to stay sober.今晚我要开车，为了保持清醒，我绝不能喝酒。 07 possess [ˈpəʊst.ɪtˌnəʊt $ ˈpoʊst.ɪtˌnoʊt] v.拥有，占有；缠住，迷住；支配；具有 (特质) 词根助记pos有权力的+ sess坐下→有权力占据→possess拥有 She finally possesses an apartment of her own.她终于拥有了属于自己的公寓。 Which physical feature, possessed by their ancestors, do whales lack?鲸鱼缺少其祖先所拥有的哪些身体特征？来源：剑9 Test1 阅读 08 embrace [ɪmˈbreɪs] v.欣然接受，乐意采纳；拥抱；包含；n.拥抱；接受；领会 词根助记em进入+brace手臂→使进入怀里→embrace拥抱，引申为”欣然接受，乐意采纳”。v.欣然接受，乐意采纳 More and more stores have embraced mobile payments recently.现在越来越多的商店支持手机支付。 Google and a number of other tech companies have embraced (at least in part) these kinds of flexible structures …谷歌和其他一些科技公司已经（至少部分地）接受了这些灵的结.来源：剑14 Test2 阅读 09 generic [dʒəˈner.ɪk] adj.属的，类的；非商标的；一般的；【计】通用的；n.无注册商标产品；通名 词根助记gener出生+ic表形容词→出生属于哪一类→generic属的，类的 The generic term for these animals is “mammals.”这些动物的类名是“哺乳动物”。 10 embryo [ˈem.bri.əʊ $ -oʊ] n.【动物学】胚胎；【生】胚胎 词根助记em使+ bry发芽+o表名词→发芽的东西→embryo胚胎，萌芽 Embryos take shape in the womb of a woman.胚胎在女性的子宫里成形。 The basic premise involves using cloning technology to turn the DNA of extinct animals into a fertilised embryo.,…其基本前提是利用克隆技术将灭绝动物的DNA转化为受精胚胎，来源：剑15 test2 阅读
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-005
content: 01 sin [sɪn] n.罪孽，罪过；罪，罪行；错误，过失；v.违反戒律；过失 联想助记唱歌（sing）太难听就是在犯”罪”（sin）。 There are seven deadly sins in early Catholic teachings.天主教早期教义中有七宗罪。 02 meddle [ˈmed.l̩] vi. 干预，多管闲事 词根助记词源同mix,miscellany.后引申词义干预，管闲事→meddle干预，多管闲事 His father is always meddling in his affairs, especially when he is playing computer games.他的父亲总是多管闲事，尤其是在他玩电脑游戏的时候。 03 rash [ræʃ] n.疹，皮疹；（短时期内）爆发的一连串；adj. 轻率的，鲁莽的 联想助记因为着急跑r到灰ash里去了，真是太”鲁莽”了(rash)。 Whenever I eat seafood, I get red rashes on my face.每次吃海鲜，我的脸上就会冒红疹子。 04 beverage [ˈbevərɪdʒ] n.饮料 词根助记bever喝+age名词后缀→beverage饮料 We have a selection of different beverages: what would you like to drink?我们有不同的饮料可供选择，你想喝点什么？ .., many beverages are sold in glass, ..许多饮料都是用玻璃瓶装的，来源：剑12 Test8 阅读 05 urge [ɜːdʒ $ ɝːdʒ] n.冲动；强烈的愿望；v. 催促；敦促，督促；鞭策，鼓动；力荐，主张；强烈要求 象形助记 These things were bought on the urge of him on November 11th.这些东西是他在“双十一”那天冲动买下来的。 They act on an urge that is common to everyone.他们的行为冲动是每个人都有的。来源：剑15 Test1 阅读 06 tap [tæp] v.利用；轻叩，轻敲；监听，窃听(电话)；开发，发掘；装水龙头；n.旋塞，龙头；水龙头；轻敲；塞子；轻拍；窃听 象形助记 We need to tap the expertise of the people we already have.我们需要利用我们现有人员的专业知识。 … without such a placebo people are unable or afraid to tap the reserve capacity of their brains..没有这种安慰剂，人们就无法或害怕开发他们大脑的储备能力。来源：剑7 Test1 阅读 A tap is drilled into the trunk …在树干上钻了一个旋塞..来源：剑17 Test4 听力 07 slag [slæɡ] n.炉渣，矿渣；v.以言词欺辱 Piles of black slag cover the ground.成堆的黑矿渣覆盖着地面。 08 plunder [ˈplʌndə(r)] v.抢劫，掠夺；n.抢劫，战利品 象形助记 The castle was plundered of its valuables.这座城堡的珍宝被洗劫一空。 09 shuttle [ˌsaɪ.ə.miːzˈtwɪnz] n.短程穿梭运行的车辆；梭子；穿梭；航天飞机；vi. 穿梭，移动；vt.往返于两地之间 词根助记shutt=shoot抛出+le表示做某种动作时所使用的东西→shuttle短程穿梭运行的车辆 People can take the shuttle bus from the subway station to the panda base.人们可以从地铁站搭乘穿梭巴士到大熊猫基地。 There’s a free shuttle service.有免费的穿梭车服务。来源：剑14 Test3 听力 10 absurd [əbˈsɜːd] adj. 荒谬的；不合理的；可笑的，荒唐的；n.荒唐的事 词根助记ab表强调+ surd哑的；聋的→走调的，不和谐的→absurd荒谬的 He looks absurd in this pizza hat!他戴着这顶披萨帽子的样子可真滑稽。 So how does the sweet if sometimes absurd sound of infant directed speech那么，婴儿定向言语中甜美但有时荒谬的声音是如何….来源：剑13 Test3 阅读
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-004
content: 01 harmonious [hɑːˈməʊniəs] adj.悦耳的；和谐的，协调的；和睦的 词根助记harmon(y)和谐+ious形容词后缀→harmonious和谐的 The sounds of their instruments blended into a harmonious whole.他们的乐器声混在一起非常悦耳。 02 vicious [ˈvɪʃəs] adj. 凶猛的，残忍的；罪恶的；恶意的 词根助记vic=vice错误，恶行+ious表形容词→vicious残忍的，恶毒的 Crocodiles are vicious animals. Stay away from them if you can.鳄鱼是一种凶残的动物，请你尽可能地远离它们。 03 contemplation [ˌkɒntəmˈpleɪʃn] n.沉思；注视；打算 词根助记con共同+templ庙+ ation名词后缀→像庙中人一样深思→contemplation沉思 The old man is deep in contemplation.老人正陷入沉思。 04 crackers n.苏打饼干，克力架；薄脆饼干；发出爆裂声的东西；圣诞彩包爆竹；爆竹；裂化设备；黑客；迷人的女子；<方>自夸的人 These soda crackers are delicious.这些苏打饼干很美味。 05 reinforcement [ˌriː.ɪnˈfɔː.smənt $ -ˈfɔːr-] n.加固；增强；强化物；增援力量；【财】加强 The man puts a nail into the wood for reinforcement.这名男子为了加固，在木头上钉了一颗钉子。 06 compensate [ˈkɒm.pən.seɪt $ ˈkɑːm-] v.弥补；赔偿；…报酬 词根助记com全部+pens花费+ate动词后缀→花费的钱全部拿回来→compensate弥补 This man is talking with his boss about compensating his occupational injuries.这名男子正与雇主协商工伤赔偿事宜。 It could compensate for the shortage of inland sites for energy production.它可以弥补内陆能源生产场地的短缺。来源：剑9 Test3 阅读 07 erection [ɪˈrekʃn] n.建造；建筑物；直立；[生]勃起 词根助记erect建造+ion名词后缀→erection建造 The erection of the new hospital took three months.这所新医院的建造花了三个月的时间。 08 supervisor [ˈsuːpəvaɪzə(r)] n.监督员，管理者，导师；监督 词根助记super在…上面+vis看+or名词后缀→在上面看，临视→ supervisor监督 The supervisor is overseeing the construction progress.监督员正在督查施工进度。 09 mien [miːn] n.风度；风采；态度；外表 谐音助记mien迷人；你的风采态度样子好迷人 He is formally dressed and has a great mien.他穿着正式，有很好的风度。 10 witty [ˈwɪt.i $ ˈwɪt̬-] adj.机智幽默的；诙谐的；妙趣横生的；说话风趣的 词根助记wit 智慧+ty形容词后缀→witty机智幽默的 The witty young man is always making his friends laugh.这位幽默的年轻男子总是能让他的朋友开怀大笑。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-003
content: 01 portray [pɔːˈtreɪ $ pɔːr-] v.描绘；描述；扮演 联想助记把颜料倒（pour）在托盘（tray）上”描绘”（portray）图画。 I like to portray beautiful flowers in my paintings.我喜欢画美丽的花。 … if the film portrays a character playing the piano, the sounds of the piano are projected..如果电影描绘了一个弹钢琴的角色，钢琴的声音就会被放出来。来源：剑11 Test4 阅读 02 onset [ˈɒnset] n(尤指某种坏事情的）开始；攻击，袭击；(疾病)发作 联想助记打开（on）设置（set），就是一个”开始”（onset）。 The sudden onset of winter wreaked havoc on transport.冬天的突然降临让交通系统陷入了混乱。 With the onset of statehood, however, the State of Alaska took over management of its own fisheries ..然而，随着州地位的确立，阿拉斯加州在州宪法的指导下接管了自己的渔业管理…来源：剑7Test4 阅读 03 countenance [ˈkaʊn.tə.nənts $ -tən.ənts] n.面容，表情，气色；v.支持，赞成 象形助记 Her countenance is showing a great deal of anger.她的表情显示出极度的愤怒。 04 filling [ˈfɪlɪŋ] n.馅；adj 能填饱肚子的 词根助记fll（使）装满；填补+动名词后缀ing→filling（补牙）填料；馅 I love the filling in the dumplings.我喜欢吃饺子里的馅儿。 05 dawn [dɔːn $ dɑːn] n.开始；黎明；开端；萌芽；v.开始；破晓；开始清楚 谐音助记dawn谐音：咚咚的一声“黎明”到来，是一天的“开始”。 The steam revolution marked a new dawn in the human history.蒸汽革命为人类历史揭开了新的篇章。 The economic importance of forests has been understood since the dawn of man.自从人类出现以来，人们就已经认识到森林的经济重要性。来源：剑7 Test3 阅读 06 file [faɪl] v.提起（诉讼），提出（申请）；把….归档；锉；列队行进；提交；n.文件；文件夹；档案，卷宗；锉刀；纵列，单列；公文箱；【计】文件 联想助记fill和file有点像，fill the file是填写”文件”（file）。 Filing for divorce is not a happy option for couples.离婚诉讼对夫言并不是一个愉快的选项。 But financially I didn’t really benefit from it, because I never filed for a patent.但在经济上我并没有真正从中受益，因为我从未提出申请专利。来源：剑14 Test1 阅读 07 scum [ˌsaɪ.ə.miːzˈtwɪnz] n. 浮沫，浮渣 象形助记 As the scum rises, skim it off.当浮沫浮起时，请将它撇去。 08 transformation [ˌtræns.fəˈmeɪ.ʃən $ -fɚ-] n.变化，改造，转变；；转型；【化〗转化；【数】变换 词根助记trans变+ form形状+ ation名词后缀→transformation变化 She went through a significant transformation in the last four years.她在过去的四年里经历了巨大的变化。 . by means of photosynthesis, forests produce oxygen through the transformation of solar energy …….森林通过光合作用转化太阳能来产生氧气..来源：剑7 Test3 阅读 09 pragmatic [præɡˈmæt.ɪk $ -ˈmæt̬-] adj. 实际的，注重实效的；国事的，团体事务的；n.爱管闲事的人；专断的人；国事诏书；实际家 词根助记prag做事+形容词后缀ic→pragmatic务实的；实用主义的 I don’t need any fancy designs, I prefer my furniture to be more pragmatic.我不需要花哨昂贵的设计，我更喜欢实用的家具。 10 pursuit [pəˈsjuːt $ pɚˈsuːt] n.追求，寻找；追赶，跟踪；事业；消遣；追踪 词根助记pursu=pursue追求+it名词后缀，表抽象名词→pursuit追求 He is in pursuit of being a rich man.他正追求着成为一个有钱人。 …thinkers throughout the ages may have struggled to reconcile the pursuit of happiness with other human values.,…一直以来，思想家们可能一直在努力协调对幸福的追求与人类其他价值观之间的关系.来源：剑13 Test4 阅读 The thylacine was not a fast runner and probably caught its prey by exhausting it during a long pursuit.袋狼跑得不快，很可能是通过在漫长的追捕过程消耗猎物精力来捕获猎物的。来源：剑17 Test3 阅读 Finding a pursuit that excites you can improve anyone’s life.任何人找到一个自己为之兴奋的事业都可以改善自己的生活。来源：剑10 Test4 阅读
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-002
content: 01 teem [tiːm] vi. 充满；大量存在于；v.生下 象形助记 The Great Wall is always teeming with tourists.长城上总是挤满了游客。 He examined a drop of water from a nearby lake and found it teeming with tiny creatures他检查了附近湖中的一滴水，发现里面充满了微小的生物。来源：剑16 Test2 阅读 02 attributable [əˈtrɪbjətəbl] adj.可归因于….的 词根助记atribut(e)….归因于 + .a.le能..的→attributable可归因于….的 The squirrels being homeless is attributable to the reduction of forest.小松鼠之所以无家可归，是因为森林面积的减少。 … accounts for 84 % of the CO2 emissions attributable to transport.因为交通运输而产生的二氧化碳排放量占了84%来源：剑10 Test1 阅读 03 soy [ˈsəʊə(r)] n.大豆；酱油 象形助记 Soy can be made into tofu.大豆可以用来制作豆腐。 04 overcast [ˈəʊ.və.kɑːst $ ˌ–ˈ- $ ˈoʊ.vɚ.kæst] adj.阴天的；阴暗的；愁闷的；v.使沮丧；遮蔽；n.．【气象学】阴，阴天；遮盖物（尤指云、雾等）；郁闷，忧愁，沮丧；[采矿】风桥 象形助记 The sky is gray and overcast.天空阴沉灰暗。 05 mitigate [ˈmɪt.ɪ.ɡeɪt $ ˈmɪt̬-] v.减轻，缓和；【财】减少 She takes the pill to mitigate the dizziness.她吃药以减轻头晕的症状。 On the question of mitigating the risks farmers face, most essayists called for greater state intervention.在减轻农民面临风险的问题上，大多数评论家呼吁加大国家干预力度。来源：剑12 Test6 阅读 06 vivid [ˈvɪvɪd] adj 生动的，清晰的（记忆、描述)；，（颜色）鲜艳的，强烈的（颜色、光）；丰富的；逼真的 词根助记viv生命+id形容词后缀→有生命的→vivid生动的，清晰的 (记忆、描述) This painting is a vivid representation of two horses.这幅画是对两匹马的生动再现。 Bingham writes about the approach in vivid style in his book.宾厄姆在他的书中生动地描述了这种方法。来源：剑12 Test6 阅读 It has also been proposed that trees may produce vivid red colours …也有人提出，树木可能会产生鲜艳的红色…来源：剑10 Test3 阅读 07 pint [paɪnt] n.品脱（容量单位，在美国约合0.473升）；【数】品脱(pt.) 象形助记 This big cup can hold a pint of beer.这个大杯子可以装下一品脱啤酒。 08 impose [ɪmˈpəʊz] v.把…强加给；强制实行，强迫接受 联想助记im (音同：硬)+ pose放，硬放就是”把…强加给”（impose) My mother always imposes pressure on me.我妈妈总是给我施加压力。 .., and that this ought to be imposed on the whole of the speech community..···.这应该强加给整个言论界。来源：剑9 Test3 阅读 09 scorch [ˌsaɪ.ə.miːzˈtwɪnz] v.烧焦；枯萎；vi.高速行驶，疾驰，飞驰 谐音助记scorch谐音：杀过去，引申为战争→战争使一切都化为焦土→ scorch烧焦 The leaves have been scorched by the sun’s heat.树叶被太阳晒焦了。 … after some of the largest fires in state history scorched thousands of acres…在该州历史上最大的几场大火烧毁了数千英亩土地之后.来源：剑10 Test4 阅读 10 huddle [ˌaɪ.siː.biːˈem] v.聚集在一起，挤作一团；把身子蜷成一团，蜷缩；使聚集在一起；n.挤在一起的人，一堆杂乱的东西 联想助记当想要cuddle（抱抱）的时候我们就huddle（”聚集在一起”) Baby penguins huddle together while their parents are not around.当父母不在身边时，小企鹅们会挤作一团。
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 考研词汇精选-001
content: 01 exclusive [ɪkˈskluːsɪv] adj. 独有的；奢华的；排外的；n. 独家新闻 词根助记ex向外+ clus关,闭+ ive 形容词词尾→都排除在外→exclusive独有的 These are the exclusive seats for our VIP.这些是我们贵宾的专属座位。 Throughout this period, the Arabs were the exclusive importers of spices to Europe.在这一时期，阿拉伯人是欧洲香料的独有进口商。来源：剑15 Test1 阅读 02 hoe [həʊ] n.锄头；v. 用锄耕地 联想助记小心不要让“锄头”（hoe）砸到你的脚趾（toe）。 I used the hoe to prepare the soil for planting.我用锄头疏松土壤，准备种植。 03 attraction [əˈtrækʃn] n.景点；吸引，魅力；有吸引力的事物；游览胜地；引力，万有引力 象形助记 The Great Wall is one of the most popular tourist attractions in Beijing.长城是北京最受欢迎的旅游景点之一。 Describe a tourist attraction you enjoyed visiting.描述一个你喜欢游览的景点。来源：剑16 Test1 口语 D Hardy’s aim was to show the attraction of isolation.哈迪的目的是展示孤独的吸引力。来源：剑15 Test1 阅读 04 emission [ɪˈmɪʃ.ən] n.排放物；发射；放射物；散发物；排放；【化】发射，放射；【物】放射 词根助记emiss放出+ion名词后缀→emission排放物 The emissions from the coal power station will pollute the air.燃煤发电站排放的废气会污染空气。 The energy use and carbon emissions this generates is spectacular and largely unnecessary.由此产生的能源消耗和碳排放物是惊人的，而且在很大程度上是不必要的。来源：剑14 Test2 阅读 05 proposition [ˌprɒp.əˈzɪʃ.ən $ ˌprɑː.pə-] n.提议；计划；命题；事业，生意；【财】提议；vt.向….求欢 词根助记propos打算，建议+ition名词后缀→proposition提议 He made the proposition to his co-workers to go out for food after work.他向他的同事提议下班后一起出去吃饭。 … to spur managers to think more expansively about how trends could engender new value propositions in their core markets,为了促使管理者更广泛地思考趋势如何在其核心市场中产生新的价值主张。来源：剑13 Test2 阅读 06 frustration [frʌsˈtreɪ.ʃən] n.沮丧，不满；挫败；【财】受挫；【法】合同无法执行，合同目的无法实现 词根助记frustrat=frustrate挫败+ion名词后缀→frustration挫败 The boy falls in great frustration because of his poor learning ability.男孩因自己学习能力差而深感沮丧。 Many bears have been seen to hit out at ice and snow-seemingly out of frustration.许多熊被看到过撞向冰雪，似乎是出于沮丧。来源：剑16 Test1 阅读 07 enact [ɪˈnækt] v.颁布；制定法律；扮演 词根助记en使….进入状态+ act行动→进入行动→ enact颁布 Congress enacted a law which would protect certain types of wild animals.国会通过了一部保护特定类型野生动物的法律。 08 vest [vest] n.汗衫，背心，马甲；v.给….穿衣服；授予；归属 象形助记 I put on my white vest to get ready for exercise.我穿上我的白色背心准备锻炼。 … fitting 26 children with audio-recording vests that captured language and sound给26个小孩穿上有录音功能的背心，以收集他们的语言文字和声音·.来源：剑13 Test3 阅读 09 torture [ˈtɔːtʃə(r)] vt.折磨；对…施以酷刑，拷问；n.酷刑，折磨；adj.遭受重创的；饱受煎熬的 词根助记tort扭转+ure表名词→扭曲别人→torture折磨 My friend tortured us with her terrible singing.我朋友用她糟糕的歌声折磨我们。 10 stroll [strəʊl $ stroʊl] v.散步；溜达，游荡；n.漫步；漫步，散步；闲荡，溜达；溜达；vt..游.；在….步在….漫步 I stroll with my dog every morning.我每天早上和我的狗一起散步。 No wonder that people who stroll around exhibitions are filled with nostalgia,..难怪漫步展览的人们充满了怀旧之情；来源：剑9 Test4 阅读
tags: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

title: 【BBC六分钟英语】看病时的尴尬你经历过吗？
content: 【英文脚本】NeilHello. This is 6 Minute English from BBC Learning English. I’m Neil. BethAnd I’m Beth. NeilLots of things can make us feel embarrassed – that self-conscious, uncomfortable feeling when your face blushes red and you wish you could just disappear. BethHave you had any embarrassing moments, Neil? NeilYes, many. Once I met my parents in a car park and I saw them arriving in their car and I waved my hands around in a very silly way. But unfortunately, I soon discovered that it wasn’t my parents. It was another couple. BethOh no, that’s really embarrassing. I remember answering the phone, I thought it was my best friend and I said ‘hello’ in a very silly voice, and then they asked to speak to my dad, and it wasn’t my friend. NeilWhat was the voice? BethHello? NeilOh dear. But embarrassment is more than just shyness and blushing. When it comes to our health, there’s no end of things to be embarrassed about. BethYes, and some people feel so embarrassed that they don’t go to see a doctor when they should, sometimes with serious consequences. NeilIn this programme we’ll be discussing the issue of medical embarrassment, and as usual, we’ll be learning some useful new words and phrases. BethSo, I have a question. Neil, according to the UK’s Nursing Times newspaper, what percentage of people surveyed said they had delayed visiting their doctor out of embarrassment, and then later been diagnosed with a health condition? Was it: a) 21% ? b) 41% ? or, c) 61% ? NeilSo I think it’s probably a lot. So c) 61%. BethOK. We will find out if that’s correct at the end of the programme. As humans we get embarrassed if we feel different from others, especially if thedifference is physical. But how does feeling embarrassed about a medical condition impact our relationship with the doctor? Here’s Dr Vanessa Apea, consultant in sexual health at Barts Hospital in London, explaining more to BBC Radio 4 programme, Inside Health: Dr Vanessa ApeaSo they’ll delay accessing the clinic, and also seeking treatment, and so then you’ll often see people that could have been diagnosed with what’s happening much earlier, and could have had earlier intervention, but it’s delayed quite significantly. And so I then feel that we see a lot of people kind of suffering in silence really. NeilMany people delay going to the doctor – they postpone going or put it off until a later time. As a result, their problem isn’t diagnosed. To diagnose means to identify a disease or health problem through medical examination. BethFor some, feelings of embarrassment are so strong they prefer to suffer in silence – to struggle with pain without seeking help - rather than visit the doctor. But fortunately, there are things you can do to help. Writing your problem down, going with a friend, and visiting a doctor you trust are some ideas Dr Apea recommends. NeilThere are ways that doctors can help as well, as Dr Vanessa Apea explains here to James Gallagher, presenter of BBC Radio 4 programme, Inside Health: James GallagherCan you tell us what techniques you use to put people at ease? Dr Vanessa ApeaI bring transparency to the conversation, and own it, and say that I’m going to be asking you some quite personal questions, and there may be also intimate examination… I want to assure you that this is confidential, that this is a safe, non- judgmental space… So really, I often name the words to create that space as well. Also in my manner, I would hope, and in my non-verbal cues. BethJames asks what doctors can do to put people at ease – to make them feel calm and relaxed - and Dr Apea describes her ideal conversation: it’s a safe space, it’s non-judgmental and what is said is confidential, kept private and not shared with anyone. NeilAs well as discussing embarrassing problems sensitively, Dr Apea also uses non- verbal cues - the expression on her face, her hand movements, and the tone of her voice, rather than words, to communicate and relax the patient. Embarrassment is normal, and with support hopefully more of us will feel safe to visit the doctor despite it. OK, Beth, isn’t it time to reveal the answer to your question? BethIt is. I asked you: What percentage of people said they had delayed visiting the doctor because they were embarrassed, but then had later been diagnosed with a health condition? Do you remember what you said, Neil? NeilYes, I think I said c) 61%. BethI’m afraid that is not the correct answer. It was, in fact a) 21% or just over a fifth. OK, let’s recap the new vocabulary we’ve used, starting with delay, to postpone or put off until a later time. NeilTo diagnose a disease or medical condition means to identify it by recognising the symptoms and examining the patient. BethIf you suffer in silence, you endure and struggle with painful feelings without asking someone for help. NeilThe phrasal verb put someone at ease means to make someone feel calm and relaxed. BethThe adjective confidential means kept private and secret and describes information which is not shared with anyone else. NeilAnd finally, non-verbal cues are types of communication using facial expressions, hand gestures or tone of voice, rather than speech, to show your feelings. Once again, our six minutes are up, but why not built your vocabulary and listening skills even more with the quiz and worksheet related to this programme? They’re both available now on our website, bbclearningenglish.com. See you there! BethBye! 【中英文双语脚本】Neil(尼尔)I’m Neil.你好。这是来自 BBC Learning English 的六分钟英语。我是 Neil。 Beth(贝丝)And I’m Beth.我是 Beth。 Neil(尼尔)Lots of things can make us feel embarrassed – that self-conscious, uncomfortable feeling when your face blushes red and you wish you could just disappear.很多事情都会让我们感到尴尬 —— 当你的脸涨红，你希望自己能消失时，那种自我意识、不舒服的感觉。 Beth(贝丝)Have you had any embarrassing moments, Neil?你有没有经历过尴尬的时刻，尼尔？ Neil(尼尔)Yes, many. Once I met my parents in a car park and I saw them arriving in their car and I waved my hands around in a very silly way. But unfortunately, I soon discovered that it wasn’t my parents. It was another couple.是的，很多。有一次我在停车场遇到了我的父母，我看到他们开着他们的车来了，我以一种非常愚蠢的方式挥了挥手。但不幸的是，我很快发现那不是我的父母。那是另一对。 Beth(贝丝)Oh no, that’s really embarrassing. I remember answering the phone, I thought it was my best friend and I said ‘hello’ in a very silly voice, and then they asked to speak to my dad, and it wasn’t my friend.哦，不，这真的很尴尬。我记得接电话时，我以为是我最好的朋友，我用非常愚蠢的声音说了一声“你好”，然后他们要求和我爸爸说话，但那不是我的朋友。 Neil(尼尔)What was the voice?声音是什么？ Beth(贝丝)Hello?你好？ Neil(尼尔)Oh dear. But embarrassment is more than just shyness and blushing. When it comes to our health, there’s no end of things to be embarrassed about.哦，天哪。但尴尬不仅仅是害羞和脸红。当谈到我们的健康时，有无穷无尽的事情值得尴尬。 Beth(贝丝)Yes, and some people feel so embarrassed that they don’t go to see a doctor when they should, sometimes with serious consequences.是的，有些人感到非常尴尬，以至于他们没有在应该去看医生的时候去看医生，有时会带来严重的后果。 Neil(尼尔)In this programme we’ll be discussing the issue of medical embarrassment, and as usual, we’ll be learning some useful new words and phrases.在这个节目中，我们将讨论医疗尴尬的问题，像往常一样，我们将学习一些有用的新单词和短语。 Beth(贝丝)So, I have a question. Neil, according to the UK’s Nursing Times newspaper, what percentage of people surveyed said they had delayed visiting their doctor out of embarrassment, and then later been diagnosed with a health condition? Was it: a) 21% ? b) 41% ? or, c) 61% ?所以，我有一个问题。Neil，据英国《护理时报》报道，有多少百分比的受访者表示他们因尴尬而推迟了去看医生，后来又被诊断出患有健康状况？是：a） 21% ？b） 41% ？或者，c） 61% ？ Neil(尼尔)So I think it’s probably a lot. So c) 61%.所以我认为这可能很多。所以 c） 61%。 Beth(贝丝)OK. We will find out if that’s correct at the end of the programme.还行。我们将在节目结束时找出这是否正确。 As humans we get embarrassed if we feel different from others, especially if the(作为人类，如果我们觉得自己与他人不同，我们会感到尴尬，尤其是当)difference is physical. But how does feeling embarrassed about a medical condition impact our relationship with the doctor? Here’s Dr Vanessa Apea, consultant in sexual health at Barts Hospital in London, explaining more to BBC Radio 4 programme, Inside Health:差异是物理的。但是，对医疗状况感到尴尬如何影响我们与医生的关系呢？以下是伦敦巴茨医院性健康顾问 Vanessa Apea 博士对 BBC Radio 4 节目 Inside Health 的更多解释： Dr Vanessa Apea(Vanessa Apea 医师)So they’ll delay accessing the clinic, and also seeking treatment, and so then you’ll often see people that could have been diagnosed with what’s happening much earlier, and could have had earlier intervention, but it’s delayed quite significantly. And so I then feel that we see a lot of people kind of suffering in silence really.因此，他们会延迟进入诊所和寻求治疗，因此你经常会看到一些人，他们本来可以更早地被诊断出患有正在发生的事情，并且可能更早地接受了干预，但延迟了相当多。所以我觉得我们看到很多人真的在默默地忍受痛苦。 Neil(尼尔)Many people delay going to the doctor – they postpone going or put it off until a later time. As a result, their problem isn’t diagnosed. To diagnose means to identify a disease or health problem through medical examination.许多人延迟去看医生 —— 他们推迟去看医生或推迟到以后。因此，他们的问题没有得到诊断。To diagnose 是指通过医学检查来识别疾病或健康问题。 Beth(贝丝)For some, feelings of embarrassment are so strong they prefer to suffer in silence – to struggle with pain without seeking help - rather than visit the doctor. But fortunately, there are things you can do to help. Writing your problem down, going with a friend, and visiting a doctor you trust are some ideas Dr Apea recommends.对一些人来说，尴尬的感觉是如此强烈，他们宁愿默默忍受 —— 在不寻求帮助的情况下与痛苦作斗争 —— 也不愿去看医生。但幸运的是，您可以做一些事情来提供帮助。写下你的问题，和朋友一起去，去看你信任的医生是 Apea 医生推荐的一些想法。 Neil(尼尔)There are ways that doctors can help as well, as Dr Vanessa Apea explains here to James Gallagher, presenter of BBC Radio 4 programme, Inside Health:医生也可以通过多种方式提供帮助，正如 Vanessa Apea 博士在这里向 BBC Radio 4 节目 Inside Health 的主持人 James Gallagher 解释的那样： James Gallagher(詹姆斯·加拉格尔)Can you tell us what techniques you use to put people at ease?您能告诉我们您用了什么技巧来让人们放心吗？ Dr Vanessa Apea(Vanessa Apea 医师)I bring transparency to the conversation, and own it, and say that I’m going to be asking you some quite personal questions, and there may be also intimate examination… I want to assure you that this is confidential, that this is a safe, non- judgmental space… So really, I often name the words to create that space as well. Also in my manner, I would hope, and in my non-verbal cues.我为对话带来透明度，并拥有它，并说我将问你一些非常私人的问题，也可能有亲密的检查……我想向你保证，这是保密的，这是一个安全、不带评判的空间……所以说真的，我也经常说出创造那个空间的词。我希望，也要以我的方式，以及我的非语言暗示。 Beth(贝丝)James asks what doctors can do to put people at ease – to make them feel calm and relaxed - and Dr Apea describes her ideal conversation: it’s a safe space, it’s non-judgmental and what is said is confidential, kept private and not shared with anyone.詹姆斯问医生可以做些什么来让人们放松 —— 让他们感到平静和放松 —— Apea 医生描述了她理想的对话：这是一个安全的空间，不带评判，所说的是保密的，保密的，不与任何人分享。 Neil(尼尔)As well as discussing embarrassing problems sensitively, Dr Apea also uses non- verbal cues - the expression on her face, her hand movements, and the tone of her voice, rather than words, to communicate and relax the patient. Embarrassment is normal, and with support hopefully more of us will feel safe to visit the doctor despite it. OK, Beth, isn’t it time to reveal the answer to your question?除了敏感地讨论令人尴尬的问题外，Apea 医生还使用非语言暗示 - 她脸上的表情、她的手部动作和她的语气，而不是语言，来与患者交流和放松。尴尬是正常的，在支持下，希望我们中的更多人会感到放心去看医生。好的，贝丝，现在是不是该透露你问题的答案了？ Beth(贝丝)It is. I asked you: What percentage of people said they had delayed visiting the doctor because they were embarrassed, but then had later been diagnosed with a health condition? Do you remember what you said, Neil?是的。我问你：有多少百分比的人说他们因为尴尬而推迟去看医生，但后来被诊断出患有健康状况？你还记得你说过的话吗，尼尔？ Neil(尼尔)Yes, I think I said c) 61%.是的，我想我说的是 c） 61%。 Beth(贝丝)I’m afraid that is not the correct answer. It was, in fact a) 21% or just over a fifth. OK, let’s recap the new vocabulary we’ve used, starting with delay, to postpone or put off until a later time.恐怕这不是正确的答案。事实上，它是 a） 21% 或略高于五分之一。好，让我们回顾一下我们使用的新词汇，从 delay 开始，推迟或推迟到以后。 Neil(尼尔)To diagnose a disease or medical condition means to identify it by recognising the symptoms and examining the patient.To diagnose a disease or medical condition 的意思是通过识别症状和检查患者来识别它。 Beth(贝丝)If you suffer in silence, you endure and struggle with painful feelings without asking someone for help.如果你默默忍受，你会忍受痛苦的感觉，并在不寻求帮助的情况下与痛苦的感受作斗争。 Neil(尼尔)The phrasal verb put someone at ease means to make someone feel calm and relaxed.短语动词 put someone at ease 的意思是让某人感到平静和放松。 Beth(贝丝)The adjective confidential means kept private and secret and describes information which is not shared with anyone else.形容词 confidential 的意思是保密和秘密，并描述不与其他任何人共享的信息。 Neil(尼尔)And finally, non-verbal cues are types of communication using facial expressions, hand gestures or tone of voice, rather than speech, to show your feelings. Once again, our six minutes are up, but why not built your vocabulary and listening skills even more with the quiz and worksheet related to this programme? They’re both available now on our website, bbclearningenglish.com. See you there!最后，非语言提示是使用面部表情、手势或语气而不是语言来表达您的感受的交流类型。我们的六分钟又一次结束了，但为什么不通过与此计划相关的测验和工作表来进一步培养您的词汇量和听力技巧呢？它们现在都可以在我们的网站上找到，bbclearningenglish.com。到时见！ Beth(贝丝)Bye!再见！ 【核心词汇】delayput off to a later time; postpone延误推迟到以后某个时间；延缓The project was delayed by unforeseen circumstances.由于不可预见的情况，项目被延误了。 diagnoseidentify a disease or medical problem by recognising the symptoms and examining the patient诊断通过识别症状和检查病人来确定疾病或医学问题The doctor diagnosed him with pneumonia.医生诊断他患有肺炎。 suffer in silenceendure or struggle with painful feelings or trauma without asking anyone for help默默忍受忍受或挣扎于痛苦的感受或创伤，而不寻求任何人的帮助She suffered in silence for years before finally seeking help.她在寻求帮助之前默默忍受了好几年。 put at easemake someone feel calm and relaxed使安心使某人感到平静和放松His reassuring words put me at ease.他令人安心的言语使我安心。 confidentialkept private and secret; information which is not shared with anyone机密的保密的；不与任何人分享的信息The information is strictly confidential.该信息严格保密。 non-verbal cuescommunication using means such as the expression on your face, hand gestures, or tone of voice to show how you feel about something, rather than using words非语言暗示使用面部表情、手势或语调等方式进行交流，以表达你对某事的感受，而不是使用文字His non-verbal cues suggested he was nervous.他的非语言暗示表明他很紧张。 在公众号里输入6位数字，获取【对话音频、英文文本、中文翻译、核心词汇和高级词汇表】电子档，6位数字【暗号】在文章的最后一张图片，如【220728】，表示22年7月28日这一期。公众号没有的文章说明还没有制作相关资料。年度合集在B站【六分钟英语】工房获取，每年共计300+文档，感谢支持！

title: 【BBC六分钟英语】什么是激励女性的使命？
content: 【英文脚本】RobHello. This is 6 Minute English and I’m Rob. DanAnd I’m Dan. RobNow, do you know who Michelle Obama is? DanEr, yes. Maybe the most famous woman in the world? Former First Lady, which means she was the wife of the President of the United States of America. RobThat is correct. She’s just published her autobiography and has been talking in the UK about her life. Before we find out more, here is this week’s question. When did the title ‘First Lady’ first become used for the wife of the US president? Was it in the: a) 18th Century, b) 19th Century or, c) 20th Century, Any ideas Dan? Dan th This could be a trick question. The first US presidents were in the 18 Century, and they had wives, but I think the actual term may only have been introduced much later – so I’m th going to take a wild guess and say the 20 Century. RobOK. Well, I’ll have the answer later in the programme. Michelle Obama’s visit to the UK was covered on BBC News. According to this report, where did she visit that she had visited before? BBC News ReportThe former First Lady spoke openly about a number of issues and one of her main messages was about empowerment. Earlier in the day Mrs Obama revisited a school in north London, a place where she says she was first inspired to focus on education during her time as the First Lady. Rob So, where did she revisit on this trip? DanShe went to a school in north London. She said it was at this school that she was first inspired to focus on education. If you are inspired to do something, you get a strong feeling that you want to do something, you feel a strong motivation to achieve something particular, often because of something someone else has said or achieved. RobThe report also mentioned that she spoke openly about a number of issues. To speak openly about something is when you discuss a subject, often a difficult subject, without trying to hide the facts or your feelings. It’s a phrase that is used when people talk about things in their life that they find difficult or embarrassing. DanOne of the things she spoke openly about was her own feeling that she didn’t really belong, that she really have the skills or talent to be doing what she was doing and that she didn’t deserve her position. RobThere is a name for that. It’s called imposter syndrome – that feeling where you think one day everyone will realise that you’re really not very good at what you do. DanI get that feeling all the time! RobI wonder why? Because the thing with this imposter syndrome is that it isn’t justified. It’s more a lack of confidence or a result of the way society labels us. DanWell, anyway, back to the report. Michelle Obama was also keen to talk about the topic of empowerment. That’s giving people the strength, confidence and power to achieve what they want in life by themselves. RobLet’s hear from Michelle Obama herself now talking about how we sometimes judge people based on their class rather than their individual abilities. Michelle ObamaThat’s often the mistake that we make, we assume that working-class folks are not highly gifted in their own right when a lot of times your station in life is limited by the circumstances that you find yourself in. RobShe says here that we assume things about people based on their social status or station in life. To assume means ‘to make a judgement which is not based on the facts but on what we think is true’. DanShe uses the phrase in their own right. When you say that someone is talented in their own right, it means that their talent comes from their own skills and abilities and not because of any connection with any organisation, individual or class that they happen to be associated with. Rob Before we wrap up, time to get the answer to this week’s question. When did the title ‘First Lady’ first become used for the wife of the US president? Was it in the: a) 18th Century, b) 19th Century or, c) 20th Century, And Dan, you said? DanI thought it was the 20th Century. RobWell, you were right. DanYay! Robth But let me finish. You were right in that it was later than the 18 Century, which was when th the first US presidents held their positions, but it wasn’t as late as the 20 Century. It was th the second half of the 19 Century when the title First Lady began to be used. Now let’s review today’s vocabulary. DanWe started with the phrase to talk openly about something. This means to discuss something, usually a difficult subject, without hiding your feelings, emotions or facts about that subject. RobThen there was the noun empowerment. This is the process of giving people the feeling that they are in control of their lives, making people more confident in their rights and abilities. Dan The verb inspire was next. If you inspire people, you give them the feeling that they want to and can do something, something difficult or creative. If you have that feeling yourself, you are inspired. RobNext there was the verb to assume something. To assume means ‘to make a judgement about someone or something not based on proof, but on things you think or believe to be true’. DanThe next phrase was in their own right. If someone is successful in their own right, for example, it means their success is because of their own skills and abilities, and not because of who they work for, or work with or which social group they come from. RobAnd finally there was the noun phrase station in life. DanYour station in life is your position in society – your social status. RobAnd that brings us to the end of this week’s programme. We’ll be back soon and in the meantime you can find us on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube our app and of course the website bbclearningenglish.com. Bye bye for now. DanBye! 【中英文双语脚本】Rob(罗伯)Hello. This is 6 Minute English and I’m Rob.你好。这里是六分钟英语，我是 罗伯。 Dan(担)And I’m Dan.我是 Dan。 Rob(罗伯)Now, do you know who Michelle Obama is?现在，你知道米歇尔·奥巴马是谁吗？ Dan(担)Er, yes. Maybe the most famous woman in the world? Former First Lady, which means she was the wife of the President of the United States of America.呃，是的。也许是世界上最著名的女性？前第一夫人，这意味着她是美利坚合众国总统的妻子。 Rob(罗伯)That is correct. She’s just published her autobiography and has been talking in the UK about her life. Before we find out more, here is this week’s question. When did the title ‘First Lady’ first become used for the wife of the US president? Was it in the: a) 18th Century, b) 19th Century or, c) 20th Century, Any ideas Dan?这是正确的。她刚刚出版了自己的自传，并一直在英国谈论她的生活。在我们了解更多信息之前，以下是本周的问题。“第一夫人”这个头衔是什么时候第一次被用来称呼美国总统的夫人的？是在：a） 18 世纪，b） 19 世纪还是，c） 20 世纪，有什么想法吗？ Dan (担 )th This could be a trick question. The first US presidents were in the 18 Century, and they had wives, but I think the actual term may only have been introduced much later – so I’m th going to take a wild guess and say the 20 Century.th 这可能是一个棘手的问题。第一任美国总统是在 18 世纪，他们有妻子，但我认为实际的术语可能只是在很久以后才引入的 —— 所以我要大胆猜测一下，说 20 世纪。 Rob(罗伯)OK. Well, I’ll have the answer later in the programme. Michelle Obama’s visit to the UK was covered on BBC News. According to this report, where did she visit that she had visited before?还行。好吧，我将在稍后的节目中提供答案。米歇尔·奥巴马 （Michelle Obama） 对英国的访问进行了 BBC 新闻报道。根据这份报告，她去过哪里，而她以前去过哪里？ BBC News Report(BBC新闻报道)The former First Lady spoke openly about a number of issues and one of her main messages was about empowerment. Earlier in the day Mrs Obama revisited a school in north London, a place where she says she was first inspired to focus on education during her time as the First Lady.这位前第一夫人公开谈论了许多问题，她的主要信息之一是关于赋权。当天早些时候，奥巴马夫人再次访问了伦敦北部的一所学校，她说，她在担任第一夫人期间第一次受到启发，开始专注于教育。 Rob (罗伯 )So, where did she revisit on this trip?那么，她这次旅行重访了哪里呢？ Dan(担)She went to a school in north London. She said it was at this school that she was first inspired to focus on education. If you are inspired to do something, you get a strong feeling that you want to do something, you feel a strong motivation to achieve something particular, often because of something someone else has said or achieved.她在伦敦北部的一所学校上学。她说，正是在这所学校，她第一次受到启发，开始专注于教育。如果你受到启发去做某事，你会有一种强烈的感觉，你想做某事，你会有一种强烈的动力去实现某件事，通常是因为别人说过或取得了成就。 Rob(罗伯)The report also mentioned that she spoke openly about a number of issues. To speak openly about something is when you discuss a subject, often a difficult subject, without trying to hide the facts or your feelings. It’s a phrase that is used when people talk about things in their life that they find difficult or embarrassing.该报告还提到，她公开谈论了一些问题。公开谈论某事是指您讨论一个话题，通常是一个困难的话题，而不试图隐藏事实或您的感受。当人们谈论生活中他们觉得困难或尴尬的事情时，会用到这个短语。 Dan(担)One of the things she spoke openly about was her own feeling that she didn’t really belong, that she really have the skills or talent to be doing what she was doing and that she didn’t deserve her position.她公开谈论的一件事是她自己觉得自己并不真正属于这里，她真的有技能或才能来做她正在做的事情，她不配得到这个职位。 Rob(罗伯)There is a name for that. It’s called imposter syndrome – that feeling where you think one day everyone will realise that you’re really not very good at what you do.它有一个名字。这被称为冒名顶替者综合症 —— 那种感觉，你认为有一天每个人都会意识到你真的不太擅长你所做的事情。 Dan(担)I get that feeling all the time!我一直都有这种感觉！ Rob(罗伯)I wonder why? Because the thing with this imposter syndrome is that it isn’t justified. It’s more a lack of confidence or a result of the way society labels us.我想知道为什么？因为这种冒名顶替者综合症的问题在于它没有道理。这更多的是缺乏自信或社会给我们贴标签的结果。 Dan(担)Well, anyway, back to the report. Michelle Obama was also keen to talk about the topic of empowerment. That’s giving people the strength, confidence and power to achieve what they want in life by themselves.好吧，无论如何，回到报告。米歇尔·奥巴马 （Michelle Obama） 也热衷于谈论赋权的话题。这给了人们力量、信心和力量，让他们靠自己实现他们想要的生活。 Rob(罗伯)Let’s hear from Michelle Obama herself now talking about how we sometimes judge people based on their class rather than their individual abilities.现在让我们听听米歇尔·奥巴马本人如何谈论我们有时如何根据他们的阶级而不是他们的个人能力来评判他们。 Michelle Obama(米歇尔·奥巴马)That’s often the mistake that we make, we assume that working-class folks are not highly gifted in their own right when a lot of times your station in life is limited by the circumstances that you find yourself in.这通常是我们犯的错误，我们假设工人阶级本身并不具有很高的天赋，而很多时候你的生活地位受到你所处环境的限制。 Rob(罗伯)She says here that we assume things about people based on their social status or station in life. To assume means ‘to make a judgement which is not based on the facts but on what we think is true’.她在这里说，我们根据人们的社会地位或生活中的地位来假设他们的事情。假设的意思是“做出的判断不是基于事实，而是基于我们认为是真实的”。 Dan(担)She uses the phrase in their own right. When you say that someone is talented in their own right, it means that their talent comes from their own skills and abilities and not because of any connection with any organisation, individual or class that they happen to be associated with.她自己使用了这个短语。当你说某人本身就有才华时，这意味着他们的才华来自他们自己的技能和能力，而不是因为他们碰巧与之相关的任何组织、个人或阶级有任何联系。 Rob (罗伯 )Before we wrap up, time to get the answer to this week’s question. When did the title ‘First Lady’ first become used for the wife of the US president? Was it in the: a) 18th Century, b) 19th Century or, c) 20th Century, And Dan, you said?在我们结束之前，是时候获得本周问题的答案了。“第一夫人”这个头衔是什么时候第一次被用来称呼美国总统的夫人的？是在：a） 18 世纪，b） 19 世纪，还是 c） 20 世纪，还有丹，你说？ Dan(担)I thought it was the 20th Century.我以为是 20 世纪。 Rob(罗伯)Well, you were right.嗯，你是对的。 Dan(担)Yay!耶！ Rob(罗伯)th But let me finish. You were right in that it was later than the 18 Century, which was when th the first US presidents held their positions, but it wasn’t as late as the 20 Century. It was th the second half of the 19 Century when the title First Lady began to be used. Now let’s review today’s vocabulary.但让我说完。你是对的，那时晚于 18 世纪，而 18 世纪是第一任美国总统任职的时候，但还没有到 20 世纪。19 世纪下半叶，第一夫人的头衔开始使用。现在让我们回顾一下今天的词汇。 Dan(担)We started with the phrase to talk openly about something. This means to discuss something, usually a difficult subject, without hiding your feelings, emotions or facts about that subject.我们从 to open ly talk about something 这句话开始。这意味着讨论某事，通常是一个困难的话题，而不隐藏您对该主题的感受、情绪或事实。 Rob(罗伯)Then there was the noun empowerment. This is the process of giving people the feeling that they are in control of their lives, making people more confident in their rights and abilities.然后是名词 empowerment。这是给人一种他们掌控自己生活的感觉的过程，使人们对自己的权利和能力更有信心。 Dan (担 )The verb inspire was next. If you inspire people, you give them the feeling that they want to and can do something, something difficult or creative. If you have that feeling yourself, you are inspired.接下来是动词 inspire。如果你激励人们，你就会给他们一种感觉，他们想做一些事情，并且可以做一些困难的事情或有创意的事情。如果你自己也有这种感觉，你就会受到启发。 Rob(罗伯)Next there was the verb to assume something. To assume means ‘to make a judgement about someone or something not based on proof, but on things you think or believe to be true’.接下来是动词 to assume something。To assume 的意思是“不是根据证据，而是根据你认为或相信是真实的事物来判断某人或某事”。 Dan(担)The next phrase was in their own right. If someone is successful in their own right, for example, it means their success is because of their own skills and abilities, and not because of who they work for, or work with or which social group they come from.下一句话本身就是他们自己的。例如，如果某人本身就成功了，这意味着他们的成功是因为他们自己的技能和能力，而不是因为他们为谁工作、与谁一起工作或他们来自哪个社会群体。 Rob(罗伯)And finally there was the noun phrase station in life.最后是名词短语 station in life。 Dan(担)Your station in life is your position in society – your social status.你的人生地位就是你在社会中的地位 —— 你的社会地位。 Rob(罗伯)And that brings us to the end of this week’s programme. We’ll be back soon and in the meantime you can find us on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube our app and of course the website bbclearningenglish.com. Bye bye for now. 本周的节目到此结束。我们很快就会回来，在此期间，您可以在 Instagram、Facebook、Twitter、YouTube、我们的应用程序，当然还有 bbclearningenglish.com 的网站上找到我们。再见。 Dan(担)Bye!再见！ 【核心词汇】empowermentgiving people the confidence and power to improve their lives themselves赋权使人们有信心和能力去改善自身的生活Empowerment initiatives are crucial for marginalized communities to overcome systemic barriers.赋权计划对于边缘化社区克服系统性障碍至关重要。 to inspireto create in people the feeling of wanting to do something and achieve something激励激发人们想做某事并取得成就的愿望His unwavering dedication inspired us all to strive for excellence.他坚定不移的奉献精神激励了我们所有人去追求卓越。 imposter syndromefeelings that you don’t deserve your position even though there is no evidence you are not suitable冒名顶替综合征即使没有证据表明自己不胜任，也觉得自己不配担任自己的职位Despite her numerous achievements, she still suffered from persistent imposter syndrome.尽管她取得了许多成就，但她仍然患有持续的冒名顶替综合征。 to assume somethingto think something is true based on your own beliefs and understanding without knowing the facts假设根据自己的信念和理解认为某事为真，而不了解事实Don’t assume his silence means agreement; get confirmation.不要认为他的沉默意味着同意；要得到证实。 in their own rightbecause of their own talents and abilities凭其自身凭借其自身的天赋和能力Her paintings are masterpieces in their own right.她的画作本身就是杰作。 station in lifeposition in society or workplace社会地位社会或工作场所中的地位Regardless of their station in life, everyone deserves respect and dignity.无论他们的社会地位如何，每个人都应该得到尊重和尊严。 在公众号里输入6位数字，获取【对话音频、英文文本、中文翻译、核心词汇和高级词汇表】电子档，6位数字【暗号】在文章的最后一张图片，如【220728】，表示22年7月28日这一期。公众号没有的文章说明还没有制作相关资料。年度合集在B站【六分钟英语】工房获取，每年共计300+文档，感谢支持！
